review: Just got back from the "Mock Service", for those you don't know what that is, it's a night where they invite locals to dine for free. It's usually a night filled with mistakes, meltdowns and mayhem-all of which is supposed to prepare the staff for the Grand Opening. I've eaten at Red Robin on numerous occasions throughout the years and surprisingly this was by far the best experience I've had there. Before even walking through the door I was happily greeted then shown to my table. My server Nadine was great! She was always cheery, her honesty was refreshing, and her recommendations were spot on!  I had the Royal Burger which is a juicy all-beef patty with american cheese, lettuce, tomato, a fried egg, mayo, in a sesame seed bun. I know great burgers and this was pretty okay. You could do a lot worse than you could better. The sweet potato fries however were spectacular!! Hot, fresh, and salted to perfection! They definitely put 80% of other restaurants' sweet potato fries to shame!  The "Freckled Lemonade" or strawberry lemonade (made with Minute Maid) was actually really good. I would order it again despite that fact that I'm not a lemonade guy.  My friend had the Riblets & Clucks, which was good. The riblet meat just fell off the bone. She also had the Oreo Shake which was undeniably great! =9 All and all, things were great here! Yes, things weren't perfect but for a mock service it was muuuuuucchhhh better than I expected.  Service: Friendly, Warm, Welcoming Food: Good, Generous, Comforting Ambiance: Bright, Fun, Lively If you're out shopping in the Santa Anita mall, and find yourself hungry, check out Red Robin.  The Cajun Cluck 'n Fries are pretty good too (if memory serves me).

They just officially opened this past Monday (Jan. 9) and although the night was filled with "mistakes, meltdowns, and mayhem" (as Jon R. put it down below), I have to give two -- yes, TWO -- extra stars for the customer service. We went last night and the wait on a Friday night was long -- roughly 30 minutes, when we were told it was going to be 10-15 minutes.  Supposedly the hostess had called our table's name several times and when we didn't respond, they told my sister that they had taken our name off the list and we would have to wait all over again.  I spoke with the hostess instead, cleared the mistake up, and was told we would be seated next.  The manager was so kind and insisted that we order an appetizer while we were waiting so that it could be served right when we sat down.  We looked over the appetizers and nothing looked appealing so we politely declined.  She then told us since we waited so long for a table, we'd get a complimentary dessert on the house.  Sweet! We were seated and our server was so, so, so nice (unfortunately, I don't remember her name).  She quickly got our round of waters and took our orders.  The table behind us, who also had her as a server, weren't so lucky :(  As she served them drinks she spilled a couple cups over and the entire table had to get up and wait for the staff to clean the mess.  It took them a really long time to clean the mess up with towels -- why doesn't Red Robin have a mop on hand, in case for spills?  That would've resolved the issue much more quickly. As for the food, I ordered Ribs & Mac 'N Cheese combo.  I'm sick with the flu, so I could barely taste anything; but what I could taste on occasion when my sinuses momentarily cleared up, wasn't bad at all.  Oh, and I can't forget the bottomless fries!  If you order anything that has a side of fries, they're "endless" (free "refills" on fries)!  So awesome.  I also ordered their Absolut Vodka Strawberry Lemonade and was quite pleased that they put actual strawberries in it!  Refills on the water were swift as well, which was pleasantly surprising.  Our server was seriously, so friendly, accommodating, and quick on her feet. When dessert time came, I reminded our server of what the manager had told us, and she told us it was no problem.  I told her we'd like the dessert with the Chocolate Chip cookie and Vanilla Ice Cream -- and when she came back, she had two in her hands!  She told us that since we were a large party of 6, they decided to give us two on the house.  SWEET. I understand since they just opened and are prone to a lot of mistakes, they have to make it up with comp'd appetizers and desserts; so this may not always be the case as their business continues.  However, considering how there weren't any huge mistakes with our party and experience (only that we had to wait a long time for our table), what Red Robin did to make up for it was more than enough! I would definitely come again!

Since this location is new, I went to check it out for lunch today and there were many staff people on hand in the restaurant.  There were 6 people, 3 on the left side and 3 on the right side of the doorway in the waiting area ready to open the door and greet you.  It was actually a little too much to have so many people standing there waiting for you to walk in.  The server was excellent and was very good about drink refills and checking up on the table.  Food is the same as any other Red Robin, so that is a good thing since this is a new location.

I was seated promptly, given my menu and given a quick sales pitch about some club card that would save me money or something. Apparently after this point I must have disappeared into thin air or become invisible, because I must have sat there for at least 15 minutes and was completely ignored. And they had plenty of staff on hand.

Located in The Promenade in Arcadia this red robin has a bar at the back of the restaurant while the dining area is in the middle and front.Was greeted promptly when I arrived also they opened the door for you which is expected from a new place.I felt like I was being ignored after they sat me.It was at least five minutes before she came to the table but she was friendly and efficient.I felt a good vibe to this place.There are lots of windows and its very bright with the lights.My burger and everything came out  the way I wanted it to be.

I will not be coming back.  First, yes endless fries sounds great, but seriously, its not that great. Their special seasoning tastes funky on the fries- too many flavors clashing. Their icecream is one-note with a lack of vanilla flavor; it tastes industrial. It tastes like they bought a gallon of it for $2. The burgers are mediocre, over-priced, and unsatisfying. I ordered the Royal Red Robin Burger, known for the burger with a fried egg inside. That excites me. Damn, I love it when I bite into a burger and experience that golden treat that just runs down the sides of the burger which marries all the flavors together... That's not what I received at Red Robin. My egg was fully cooked, when I specifically asked for the yolk to be runny. Once the egg is fully cooked, it adds nothing special to the hamburger. They screwed up on the most crucial part of the burger, the one unit that makes that burger special, the egg. My friend ordered the Bacon Burger and ate 1/4 of it before he gave up and told me it was disgusting. By the way, we were quite hungry as well, and we're not nit-pick eaters. I'll give them props for the appetizer of fried mushrooms and fried zucchini, however, the serving was way too small and it was definitely over priced. If you want fried zucchini, go to Jim's. If you want fried mushrooms, go to Everest in La Canada. Its worth it, but this is not. Btw, I got food poisoning after my meal and had to immediately use their restroom. (I also asked for the patty to be fully cooked, but was disappointed again with pinkness). My other friend ordered a burger with mushrooms - they were extremely sad. They were like... boiled... or "sauteed" in water. No caramelization on the mushrooms to bring out that natural steak flavor... Again disappointed. Spent 17$ on a bad root beer float, a couple scraps of fried mushroom and zucchini, a bland medium sized burger, and a side of fries...  There are a few things that I would compliment them on - nice service. However since it is new, it seems a little over-done with the "HEY WELCOME TO REEEED ROBINNN!" Its too fake. But anyway, the service was decent. The waiter spilled 7 cups of water as he handed it to our table, but a team was joined to quickly recover the mess. I don't mind the water spill too much since the restaurant is somewhat new, however it was pretty awkward. The bathrooms were nice and clean, but again, its a new restaurant. It better be clean. The ambiance is nice. Casual. Good for big groups. They separated the check for us which is always a nice thing for them to do.  Giving a 1-Star to a restaurant means I would not come back. It also means with the money given, I could have cooked a MUCH better meal. It also means I must have left feeling sickly, jipped, and turned-off.  I hope that this review would not destroy their business but in fact make it better. Hopefully one of the workers or managers would come across this and find it as constructive criticism.

Friendly service, mid-range prices, endless fries. The food's not great, but at least you're guaranteed to get filled up on the endless fries or drinks. Just be asian and share one order of drinks/fries with a few people - I reckon it's justifiable, given the prices. Most of the food is pretty bland, and honestly, it's like eating at a higher calibre McDonald's but you're paying twice the amount. It also worries me that I went opening week and it still didn't blow me away; imagine what it's like on a normal, run-of-the-mill weekend. I agree with Luther that some of the servers are overdoing it. On leaving the store, one worker dragged out a "Thank you for coming to Reddddddddddddd Robinnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnns," just like that, and then snickered afterwards. Really professional, guys. Do not pass go, do not collect $200.

Being that this Red Robin location is new, many things should be expected and many things should be forgivable. Unfortunately, the errors and experiences that my party/family and I encountered on our visit here warranted the 2-star rating I am about to write. Long said short, they had some inexperienced servers on staff [actually, just the server that was assigned my party], that lacked sensitivity, awareness, and presence to the customers.  Three of us ordered the Strawberry Lemonade and when all 3 drinks were drained, one of us asked for refills. The server brought back just one cup, while the other two remained empty. The server also neglected removing the empty cups and it wasn't until there were 6 empty cups of Strawberry Lemonade remnants on our table that ANOTHER server came by and picked up after our server. We asked for Tabasco sauce a total of 4 times before we finally got it. We had to ask other servers on 3 separate occasions to locate our server for us because he would be gone for extended periods of time. We ordered 6 entrees and had to wait 30 minutes for 4 out of 6 entrees to arrive at the table. The 5th order was wrong and was asked to be sent back, while the 6th entree was missing in action. It took them an additional 20 minutes on top of the 30 we had already waited for the final entree to show. It just so happens that the 6th entree belonged to my diabetic father, who does not have the luxury of waiting around for food that gets inexplicably delayed when his blood sugar level is not right. Management had stepped in and tried to correct things, such as taking $50 off our tab [greatly appreciated] and offering us free dessert [we were too full.. either from the food or from the hot air of frustration.. I wasn't sure], but it was a bit too little too late. Upon leaving, the staff gave us a survey to fill out online, which I gladly did. I received a call from management two days later and they offered to send me a $50 gift card to give them a second chance. I was already planning on giving Red Robin in Arcadia a second shot because I like fries and bottomless fries is my doom. With regards to the food, I ordered the chophouse burger which was supposed to have horseradish mayo, fried onions and mushrooms on top of swiss. The meat on the burger was a little dry and had absolutely no flavor to it. There was no juiciness, no flavor in the meat, and the taste of the toppings and sauce between the buns did NOT blend with the burger. I was pretty disappointed. The fries that came with the first wave of entrees were lukewarm to cold, which made us even more upset. When management had taken notice that our server was being less than.. 'serviceful', our fries magically appeared freshly fried, hot, and crispy, and our drinks were refilled almost immediately. But again, a little too little too late. If you come to this RR, be forewarned that they'll need a few more weeks to work out their kinks and to weed out their bad servers from their good ones. I will be back just one more time - hopefully to a better experience.
Everyone there is extremely friendly and polite. Smiles all around. Can't go wrong with bottomless strawberry lemonade and their onion rings. New location so it's super clean

New Red Robin... in Arcadia... The burger is huge... not bad... but again... it's a huge burger.. The fries is all you can eat... wow... one serving is enough for me!! Everyone is friendly... even the manager... trying to hit on me.... naughty boy!!

We went in for lunch on Sunday and was promptly greeted and seated.  Then it all went downhill from there....  We waited fifteen minutes for our server to take our order because...they had to go find her.  Where was she...shopping at Gap?  So we ordered two burgers.  Pretty simple order, nothing complicated.  We waited another fifteen minutes for her to return empty handed and she told us she would check on our order.  Ten minutes after that we got our food.  So from seating to eating it was a total of 40 minutes for two burgers.  I have been to other Red Robins and this one has the most terrible service!  Food is ok, same quality as other RR chains.

My girlfriend and I went to this Red Robin on 1/29/12 for lunch.  To sum the experience up, I'd say "chaos & confusion."  When we sat down, a young lady came up, identified herself as our server and took our drink order.  Then a guy came up and identified himself as our server.  Then a third person, another young lady, came up and identified herself as our server.  Then the 2nd server, the guy, came back and said he was really our server and sorry for the confusion. We ordered some appetizers, these jalepeno bottle caps and fried mushrooms.  We also split a burger which we wanted "as rare as you can make it" and with sweet potato fries.  After we put in the order, the waiter came up and said he was no longer our waiter and that the 3rd server we met at the beginning was now our new server.  Great. We got the appetizers and there were 40 jalepeno bottle caps and 4 mushrooms.  Just 4.  Very off-balanced.  Then we got our burger, which not only was cooked well done, but had regular fries.  We told the waitress it was wrong and she went back to the kitchen.  Then a manager came by and told us they overcooked the 2nd burger as well.  We finally got the burger after 3 attempts and it was average, at best.   When we wanted the check the waitress said the manager had the ticket, she couldn't find him, so she couldn't bring us the bill.  Really?   Oh, I almost forgot - during the time we were waiting for the check, I got up to use the restroom and server #2 (the guy) stopped me and asked "Can I help you sir?"  I didn't realize that going to the restroom was suddenly strange behavior for someone at a restaurant.   After all of this, did they offer to comp our drinks or appetizers or get a free dessert?  No.  Nothing.  Needless to say we won't ever go to that Red Robin again, or probably any other one.  We can get much better burgers at half a dozen other places without the headache.

You know what I am going to up my rating for this place. I've been here two other times since my last review. On my second visit our waiter was Nathan who's service was on point. He refilled our drinks without  us asking and he always checked up on us.  Now onto my most recent visit which was today (Friday night). First off we got seated right away, a plus. But then things started to go south. Our table didn't have silverware or napkins and then it was over five minutes before anyone even came to our table. I had to flag someone down (Thomas) who informed us who our waitress should have been (Kelly) but she was nowhere to be found. He then introduced is to Denise who would fill in. After that things were looking up again. Denise took our drink and food orders. Many other waiters had checked on us to make sure we had what we needed but none of them was Kelly. I am still giving this place an upgraded rating because they took measures to rectify the situation. I like this place and I will continue to check in. Again thanks to the great servers: Kevin, Nathan, Thomas and Denise. You guys rock!

Came in for Happy Hour today (which is M-F 3:00-6:00 & 8:00 til close). I got a Stein of the Sam Adams Alpine Spring & an order of wings. The restaurant had a decent amount of people but wasn't too busy. The bartender was really attentive & everything came out quickly: got my beer shortly after my order & the wings a few minutes after that. I highly recommend coming here during the week for Happy Hour. It's not as busy as it is Fridays or over the weekend and the service is top notch.

Man Red Robin blows. Red Robin probably takes the cake for "the product is a lot smaller than it looks in the advertisement," even beating out repeat offender Carl's Jr. It's a wonder how this chain can survive in the land of In-n-Out, I could get two double-doubles and an animal fries for the price of one of their burgers, which are not that big. Appetizers severely overpriced. Best burgers in town still at Stacked Sandwich,  . Bigger, better, cheaper burgers.  Red Robin is a less-than-noteworthy addition to the Santa Anita Mall.

Came in to redeem my free birthday burger today and was pretty unsatisfed with the quality and quantity of food. Our server Michael was really nice though. I ordered a 'shroom burger with a little bit of pink and it came super dry. I sent it back and it took maybe 15 mins to get another one... didn't know a burger could take so long to make. Any who, burger came back and it was barely pink, still dry, bland, it was totally lacking flavor.  Ended up taking a couple bites and tossing the rest. We had ordered an appetizer too, fried zucchini and mushrooms, there was probably 4 pieces each, super small portions! Should've just ordered the onion tower. So overall I don't think id be back, even for a free birthday burger. I understand they're new and tried to give them the benefit of the doubt but great customer service isn't going to cut it. Sorry! The check came and they ended up charging us for 2 burgers! I had split my burger so not sure why I was charged for a whole burger... and it was suppose to be free too! Hmm this meal is just going completely downhill.

Compared to other Red Robin locations this one is small and has its bar in an odd location in the back. Service in the couple times I have been here is worse than my usual Red Robin. Food is still good but my soda was empty more than it was full.

My husband and I have enjoyed Red Robin for many years. When the Arcadia location opened up we went in to try it. The first time we were there, the food was decent and the service attentive, but today was a nightmare.  We were seated in one of the booths in the bar area. The restaurant was very busy, so we sat down at a table that had not yet been cleared. We waited 10 minutes and asked on 2 separate occasions to have the table cleaned.  Once the waitress took our drink order, we waited another 10 minutes for her to come back and take our lunch order. We ordered an appetizer and a chicken sandwich. Needless to say, this waitress must have never waited on tables before. We watched other people being seated, ordering and getting their food and we still were waiting for our appetizer. After 30 minutes, we still had no appetizer. FINALLY, we receive only HALF of the appetizer order. We ordered sweet potato fries and fried zucchini. The sweet potato fries come out somewhat cold, like they had been sitting up on the counter for a while. The waitress goes back to get the zucchini and delivers the zucchini and it's dripping in grease. It was super  gross!  There literally was a puddle of grease at the bottom of the basket.  We were so hungry, we ate the appetizers and another 20-25 minutes went by and still no main course. We only ordered one chicken sandwich, how hard can it be?  When I saw a couple sit down at the bar and served their food within 10 minutes, still not having received our main course, that was it.  We had seen several tables come and go since we had been sitting there and still had no food.  I told my husband I was over it and wanted to leave. It took another 5-10 minutes just to get our waitresses attention so we could tell her to forget it. When she came back with the bill, she said that the manager had comped the meal.  My question......WHAT MEAL?  We had a appetizer, that was already comped through Red Robins Club and. $2.50 iced tea. So basically, they comped my iced tea.  Then the waitress blamed the problem on the kitchen staff. She stated that one of the cooks called in sick and they were short staffed. To me, that was no excuse.  An experienced waitress should be aware of their tables and if their customers have been served what they ordered. She walked by our table about 10 times and should have noticed that we had not received our order and should of asked the cooks, where the food was for our table. The staff is horribly inexperienced and the managers are even worse. I think Red Robin corporate needs to do a drop by and see how this place is being run. I don't think I will be back.

When I first bite into a well-executed burger, I expect to taste a smoky just-off-the-grill essence followed by a strong beefy infusion. In-N-Out and Islands executes the above flawlessly. Even Carls Jr delivers the quintessential burger experience. Red Robin fails!  I tried the "burning love" burger because I appreciate my food with a spicy kick. The burger tasted flat. You can sense that there was meat somewhere in there but none of the beefy goodness came through. Bite after bite, nothing in the it told me I was eating a hamburger. Islands is a better choice for restaurant burgers. The epitome of restaurant burgers is the Back Abbey in Montclair.

I was hesitant to come to this location because of all the horrible reviews. But, my boyfriend has never tried and Red Robin's endless fat fries are a right of passage; so, we headed on over.  The service was stellar! Didn't have a problem. But, the table next to us was looking for their server 75% of the time.  The only docking of stars for me is the food. I mean maybe I deserve it because I ordered a SALAD at Red Robin but I was just throughly unimpressed with their salad dressing. Their balsamic vinaigrette was awfully tangy but not in the sour-y way. I'm not sure how to explain it but it just didn't taste right.  But, the main attraction was perfectly cooked. The fries were PIPING HOT which also meant that my-hasty-self burnt the roof of my mouth. That's a first for me - burning the roof of my mouth by eating fries. But, delicious!  I'm glad there's a closer location now!

Service was okay, our waitress was very nice and friendly, but the poor thing got sucked into some issue with a customer complaining about portion size and whatever so she was unavailable as much as we would have liked...anyway, we got the: prime chopped burger (something like that?): We ordered protein style, and boy was it a giant lettuce wrap! It was like a salad...very messy. Taste-wise it was okay, though I remembered red robin's being better than that a few years ago. The beef patty was covered in sauce, so I really couldn't taste it... bottomless fries: Not as "crispy on the outside, soft/fluffy on inside" as I remember either. Doused the suckers in a ton of red robin's seasoning...it was also super oily. I think I didn't like the taste of the oil that they used for frying.  Overall, it was just a meh. Average at best, but lacks very much in terms of flavoring. I will give it another try...maybe it was just that day or my experience being soured by the loud complaining lady behind me.

Horrible!! I was in the area and wanted to give this place a try. When me and my girlfriend sat down, we looked at the menu, and I told her what I wanted and for her to order for me if the server comes. I went to the restroom, and when I came back, the server did come. After after my girlfriend order the cheese sticks for our starter, the server left and didnt come back for a long time. When he finally came back, he stood away while asking us what we wanted. Shouldnt he be standing closer and in between us? But besides that, right after we told him which burger we wanted, he left. I had to wait a long time again before he came back, in order to get some ranch and honey mustard sauce.  Throughout the time we were eating, he never came back to check on us. We saw him goofing around in the kitchen area with a female co worker instead. Seeing how they offer bottomless fries, I asked for another batch, but when it was brought over, it was really soggy. Seems like it was old fries.  I then remember that they offer you a free burger on your birthday month. So I told the server that. And he asked if I wanted a birthday sundae. I said sure. After he came with the check, I paid. But I never received my changed back. I was going to leave the rest as tip anyways, but for him NOT to bring it back was really annoying to me.  We waited a few minutes for the ice cream sundae to come. But it never came. About 15 minutes later, I was able to flag the server down and asked him about the sundae. He said "OH!!!"  He forgot my ice cream. Im not a big fan of sweets, but the fact that he offered me a sundae and forgot to bring it. And the face that my change was never brought back to me. I will never come back to this place ever again!! Oh yeah, our server's name was Thomas. Just in case someone on here gets him. Good luck with service.

I used to love Red Robin in college and haven't had it since. I thought the burgers were good but when I went to this location recently it wasn't as good as I had remembered. Maybe it's just this location? I dunno. Thankfully, the bottomless fries and speckles lemonade were still delicious!

Wow, I'm surprised this Red Robin got such bad reviews!  It seems like you got really bad service or you got good service. I recently came here twice this year.  Once was with friends.  At that time, our server was friendly but he was a bit absent for awhile.  It was hard to track him down just so we could get our refills of our freckled strawberry lemonade or even get our free appetizer (from joining Red Royalty).  Service at that time wasn't great.  It was a Sunday night and it was actually pretty crowded!   I don't know why but I think I was trying to be healthy so I ordered a salad, which was just ok. The 2nd time I came here, I really enjoyed it!  I joined Red Royalty card and they give you a free burger for your birthday.  You have the whole month of your birthday to use up the free burger.  Mine was expiring in 5 days so hubby and I came here on a Monday night.  Not crowded at all. I got the A1 peppercorn burger and it was delicious!!!  It's a huge burger and comes with applewood smoked bacon, crispy onion rings, peppercorns.  It was delicious and peppery and the burger didn't even need any ketchup because it was flavorful.  It is a huge burger so it kinda sits in your stomach for awhile since it's pretty heavy.  Comes with bottomless fries - but we didn't get 2nds or 3rds.  One was enough!  The burger seriously sits heavily in your stomach so no room for more fries! Hubby got some shrimp tacos and he said it was ok.  He liked my burger better. Our server was nice and attentive.  He even brought me my 2nd refill of my freckled strawberry lemonade without my asking!  He checked up on us, too.  Granted, it was a Monday night and not a Saturday night.  But I thought he was efficient and friendly. Strawberry freckled lemonade is yummy!  Sweet and tangy with real pieces of strawberries.  Free refills! I would love to come back to try the other burgers!  Or maybe just order the peppercorn burger again.  Yum! Thanks Red Robin for the free birthday burger!

I am going to bat for RR right now at the Santa Anita location. I have always loved RR and bummed that there was never one closer to me. Parking was of no concern because I was wondering the mall, but they do have parking spaces for take-out right at the bottom of the stairs near Macy's.  I was super excited when this one opened! I came in a little before traditional dinner time. The place was jam packed busy. I sat at the bar and the 2 gals were clearly busy but still acknowledged me right away. I got my adult beverage quickly and my order was taken. I got my food in less than 10 minutes. The bbq chicken wrap was flavorful and not drenched in bbq sauce. I got my beer for free and had half the wrap left to take home. Not a bad day at all.  For those of you who had a lack luster experience at the rojo robin...sorry bout it.

Love this place. Good burgers an good service. The only complaint was they forgot my appetizer. However they did make up for it. They paid for the late appetizer an gave us a gift card for an appetizer next time we came. They kept apologizing too. So all in all it was a great time!

Been to Red Robin's all over California. I was excited to know there was a Red Robin's close to my bf's place. Well, it is somewhat new here and I wanted to check it out and grab a good burger. It is quite busy here. I always get my usual Royal Red Robin Burger. It has a fried egg with applewood smoked bacon, American cheese, crisp lettuce, fresh tomatoes and mayo. You get to choose your buns and they ask you how you like your meat cooked and I say some pink please. I also like to drink there Freckled Strawberry Lemonade here. It is refreshing and it has strawberries inside.  There burgers aren't the BEST, however, it is a decent, good place if your craving a burger and your nearby the Santa Anita Mall and you don't want to eat at the Food Court or Restaurant. The price here is decent and the service here is okay. They just need to improve on that and this place would be much better!

I love coming here with my friends, the workers are friendly and I love the environment. I ordered some mushroom burger and it was alright, it could of tasted better, it was a little plain, but their endless garlic fries and strawberry lemonade is deliciouss!

Reeeed Robiiin.. YUUUUMMMM!!!! (yes I do sing it every time I see one) went there on a Friday night, surprised that it wasn't packed... couple of people sitting at the bar... 2 other tables besides us sitting there eating.. weird (specially during happy hour) Waiter was TOOOOO sloooowww...  Finally he came by asked for drinks, looked at the menu and ordered a "sand in your shorts" because it sounded funny! It was an ok drink, not too strong, but not too fruity..  Got the guacamole burger with added mushrooms. The size of the burger is really big which I like.. tasted really good as well. It was cooked perfectly and the fries were amazing as always... But the fries were so hot they burned our tongue, and the burger wasn't warm enough...  Got a second order of fries since we were still drinking away.. Second round: "kamikaze on the rocks please." 5 min later the waiter comes back, "did you want that as a shot?" Me.. "No, On the rocks.." 15 min later, asked if our drinks would be ready soon... "yes yes, its coming"  10 min after that, "can we get the check please?" waiter: "oh the drinks are almost ready, i'll go them" Me: "bring the check with it please" 4 min later... got the drinks, they were not good =/ BOOOO Food was good... very good... waiter not so much... drinks not so much... I was gonna give them 4 stars because I love them, but this location was really bad with the service. =/

I took my daughter there yesterday for her birthday and had horrible service. Upon walking in I informed the hostess that it was my daughters bday she stated she would notify our server. After being seated it took a while for the server to approach our table once she did she took our order and we didn't see her for a while. Our drink were given to us minutes before our food arrived and after we received our food the server did not return to check on us nor to give us a refill on our drinks. After requesting our check my daughters birthday wasn't even acknowledged. The service here is horrible and I would not suggest this place to anyone! I've been to the place in San Dimas and received excellent service but this place no not good at all and the worse part the place wasn't even busy.

Went to watch The Avengers on Monday evening, and since I haven't been to Red Robin in a quick minute, bf and I decided to go there and get some boigas afterwards. Sadly to say..every time I've been to R.R, I've NEVER ordered a burger.. -_- So..I was forced to. Well not really..I agreed to it.  It was around maybe 7:00pm, and it was pretty empty. We walk in..no one greets us, and all of the workers sort of just look at us and help the other tables out. We were standing there for a good like 4-5 minutes without anyone saying anything.  Me-I'm yelping this shit.. FINALLY..the hostess acknowledges us and says she'll be with us in a minute.  -__- come onn.  Got seated..and our waitress was kind of weird o.o She would deeply stare at us with a crazed smile. As my bf said, "It was like she was looking into my soul." Which, he was right. She was very cheerful (nothing wrong with that), but also awkward at the same time.  I ordered me the guacamole bacon cheeseburger, and the bf ordered the A1 burger.  Endless fries..fuck yes (with a side of ranch..MM) I actually think R.R has the best ranch.  We got our fries a couple minutes later, and it was fackin' on fire. But yummy.  Our food came out a bit later as well, and I'm happy to say that my burger was pretty damn mutha fuckin' delicious! Inhaled everything! Their guac was pretty good too. I'm usually skeptical of getting anything with guacamole at american type restaurants.  4 stars for the quality of the food!
Uh-oh!  Everything is good, just don't look at the calories on the menu.  That is scary!

Tried this place on lunch time yesterday. We were greeted by a friendly hostess who was holding menus in front of the entrance door, and she took us to a table located at the end of the hall which was kind of isolated from other customers and cozy, which was good. My two sons ordered fried chicken stick and corn dog from a kid's menu, and I and my wife ordered BBQ chicken burger ($9.99) and Tavern double burger ($6.99).  All food was good and delicious, and the server was very friendly and she checked us several times if we need anything else. Also, she gave us free refill of drinks and french fries. Slight negative thing was that we had to wait a little long time until the server comes to our table and take our orders. I was about to go to the front to call someone to make an order, but finally the server came. Other than that, everything was very good, and we had a good time in Red Robin. Will come back another weekend for casual hamburger lunch.

I wish I had some good news, but... Sadly, I gave it another shot a few weekends ago, and again I was NOT impressed with the service in the least. I have a hard time accepting crummy service if a restaurant is NOT busy. They seated us at a dirty table, and I had to wait about 5 minutes for a staff member to walk by so I could ask to get it cleaned. It then took another 10 minutes before the waitress appeared to get our drink order. I asked to have the table cleaned once again, and she said she'd send someone out. Finally after another 5+ minutes of waiting it got cleaned, and excuse my french but he cleaned it half a$$ed.  I saw plenty of staff around the restaurant, but they seemed to be more engaged in flirting with fellow co-workers, or talking about their weekend plans near the kitchen than actually serving customers. I never saw a manager walking around, and even though the place was only a quarter full with patrons, the wait times for ordering, food delivery, and refills was just ridiculous. I'm really disappointed. I guess when it's time to get my Red Robin fill I'll have to head over to the San Dimas location, where I've never been dissatisfied with my service, or my experience.

Went there after the movie with my wife tonight and experienced some horrible service. The restaurant was 2/3 empty and no one came to seat us down even though at least 3 servers there saw us(including one man who looked like a manager),we stood there for like 10 minutes without anyone even bother to stop by and acknowledge us. I even saw two customers at the one of the table waiving for service while we were waiting there. Me and my wife walked out and we both know we won't be going back there for sure. Come on even if they were busy they could at least tell us that someone would be seating us soon!!! Not to mention a restaurant that was 2/3 empty at the time.
Wasn't impressed. The steak fries are ok and bottomless but didn't even bother to get more..

The service was great from beginning to end here. Even down to the manager himself checking in on us a couple of times and saying goodbye to us as he held the door open for us! The refilled my soda without me even noticing!  The food was delish and was very fresh. Will definitely eat here again!

Horrible service today.  I was there when it first opened and the service was stellar, I guess now that the training staff has gone home things have changed.  I can't blame the poor waitress, it seemed like she was the only one working the whole restaurant in the middle of the day.  The burger was okay, but definitely not worth $10.

A lot of people complain about the service, I don't know why though since my waitress was fabulous. She kept coming back to check on us and make sure that everything was okay. We didn't have to ask for refills since she was the one who asked us if we wanted refills.  I got the Red Tavern and Root Beer Float. The Red Tavern was pretty tasty and is probably the cheapest burger they serve. The Root Beer Float was delicious and I like that I can get as many refills as I want. I got three refills and the waitress didn't seem to mind. The bottomless steak fries aren't that great but I have no complaints since they're bottomless. I pretty much ate until I felt like I was about to explode. I ended up paying about $10 and I know I ate way more than my money's worth. The biggest downside is that I probably ate my whole day's worth of calories in one sitting. I would return more if it didn't make me feel so fat.

I'm not too big of a burger person. Red Robin's is alright. Good for large groups and a satisfying meal. Pretty good deal for bottomless fries and freckled lemonade. I love the freckled lemonade! It's pretty sweet though so I recommend getting the light version. Personally, I like skinny fries, but Red Robin's has spices that you can add to the fries that makes it yummy. They also have lots of different sauces to try. My family got a chicken wrap (good but nothing special) and a Burnin' Love Burger (which was actually pretty good but oily). Service was a bit slow, but I was there around 9-10pm that night I guess.

The place is nice and big and has a good outdoor seating area. I had the skinny lime margarita, and the souper sandwhich combo ( BBQ chicken wrap and tortilla soup). It was crazy looking at the calorie count in most of there food, so beware dieters. The hummas plate and onion tower we also good we shared them with the table. My nephew got the chicken fingers but they were very greasing not much chicken inside. overall it was okay !

It was my first time coming to a Red Robin actually. I didn't know that this location was fairly new. My first impression when I walked in, I didn't see any employees for the first three minutes, which was fine, it wasn't as packed as I thought it would be for dinner. The environment is very clean. The customer service is amazing. I enjoyed that they did a welcoming environment, especially when it is my first time. When we ordered, the service was quick. I ordered the Burnin' Love burger, all burgers came with fries. Unfortunately, my fries were old. We ordered a new batch and it was quick and hot! I love their seasoning, I was even thinking of stashing it in my purse! Haha! Overall, I would definitely come back here.

Went in last Saturday with my family and had high expectations.  We were sadly disappointed.  Having had past positive dining experiences at other Red Robin restaurants we decided to give it a try since we were at the mall.  Well the burgers were not up to par and the fries were cooked on the outside, raw on the inside.  This would have been a moment where Gordon Ramsey would have gone mad!  Well, let's just say that the whole family was dissatisfied and as soon as my card was run and I got the check back, we left without saying a word.  Nice ambiance but terrible food, at 2:15pm on a Saturday!!!  At least after responding to the survey I was given, and filled out while I was writhing in pain that evening, I got a call back 8 days later after sending a follow-up message to the email I was sent 2 days after I sent the  survey telling me I'd receive a response in 24 hours.  A lot left to be worked on there.  Maybe they will get it right next time, if there is a next time!

Dammit. I hate this particular Red Robbin but I hate CPK even more hence I'm here, eating away. The problem isn't the food, it's the lack of service.  Ashley checked up on us once, at the end, and some chick Rachel? ignored when I asked for napkins. There weren't any napkins on my table prior to my request. No napkins thinking cause we Asians, we just need chopsticks.  I can vent more but whatever, its better than CPK.

I have been disappointed by this particular Red Robin again and again. The only pros for this place is that it's clean and the food's in the middle of average and good. The most frustrating thing about the restaurant was the lack of service. The restaurant wasn't packed, but it still took five minutes for someone to come by to take my order. After my TO GO order was taken I went back to work and came back in 20 minutes. I got my order and left to go eat somewhere else. What ticked me off was that they forgot to include any condiments for my order. No ranch for the salad, no ketchup for the burger and fries. The food is good, no doubt about it, but I won't be going to this Red Robin anytime soon.

So, I've been to Red Robin a few times and I don't think there's anything spectacular about the food by any means. They have a great selection of burgers and of course your bottomless fries which can do you no wrong whatsoever especially if you're a potato head like me. FOOD = 3 Stars: It's pretty average and there's nothing that jumps out in my mind that says I want to go to Red Robin. The portions are huge if you do enjoy that. However, I always feel like I'm going to explode when I'm done eating. That's beside the point, but the quality of the food is still under the 3 stars range. ATMOSPHERE = 3 Stars: It's your regular loud bunch of people. I have no problem with the atmosphere by any means so no real complaints here. SERVICE = 1 Star: On on occasion, my water had a fly in it and then when the waitress gave me a "new" glass of water, it had lip marks on it. That was a fail. I understand not seeing the bug or whatever, but the lip marks? Gross. The second time, the problems started when we first arrived. There was no one managing the people coming in so there were 8 of us just standing around for a few minutes while we waited for someone to remember that there were unattended customers at the front. Even when doing so, there was no apology for the long wait or anything of that nature. I decided to let it slide, but it was just downhill from there. When they finally sat us down, they had the bartender take care of us. He took our order and mysteriously disappeared. He didn't reappear until it was time to pay. I understand that he works the bar, but if that's the case, give us an actual waiter/waitress. So, some other guy was taking care of us and in our order, we ordered Sweet Potato Fries. When it arrived, it was greasy as all hell. I know fried foods are a given to be greasy, but this was unacceptable. It had a sheen and glimmer of oil that was really disgusting. So, we had to call him back (he dropped it off and disappeared) because he didn't bother to look at what he gave us and we decided to cancel our side order. I am not one to cancel an order, but this was gross. We even took pictures of the food and took the names down of  waiters in case I decided to contact their corporate folks. That's how annoyed I was with everything. Not to mention that no one checked on us once we got our food. RECOMMENDATION: Eat here if you want to experience it, but I think people would be better off if they stayed away or even went to another location (like West Covina) instead of this one. If you decide to skip over this place, don't worry... you're not missing much. Since the last incident, I've opted to not come back here for a while (or a long while) because the experience was so bad. I think other places have better burgers and more importantly way better service for that matter.

Try the new BBQ Chicken wrap!  You can never go wrong with this place there is a lot of items to choose from and they are all very good from salads to burgers!  They also have great milk shakes so try the new mint chocolate fudge its good!

I have no complaints about this location. I used to go to the Whittier location and would rate that a mediocre location because of the food but I really love the food, service and ambiance of this place.  The Veggie! A MorningStar Farms® Grillers Prime® Veggie Burger topped with caramelized onions, grilled garlic-Parmesan zucchini, shredded romaine lettuce and fresh tomatoes. Served on a whole grain bun slathered with balsamic cream. BOCA Original Vegan Burger patty also available. Straight from their website. This burger was bomb. SO good. And I get one free for my birthday fries and all. :D But I would totally come without a birthday coupon too. The mac and cheese and onion rings were also winners. Bottomless steak fries are cool, but I'm not a huge fan of steak fries.  This place is right on the promenade of the Santa Anita mall so it's very convenient after or before shopping. Lots of indoor parking and outdoor.

The service was horrible manager sat us and the server never came to take our drink order or the food didn't even show up. People that sat after us got the server right away, he came with their drinks and then tok their food order rght away. He nor anybody else ever came to help us, never going back very bad service here.

The reason I am giving this restaurant 3 stars is because of the amazing service. We had a small problem not worth mentioning and the waitress and manager were so kind and took care of it right away. I was there yesterday which was a Friday and the manager was male. Unfortunately I didn't get his name but he was very professional and kind. I give his service 5 stars. The food however, was not amazing which was not the location's fault which is why I didn't give low stars. The fries were bottomless which was great, but they weren't my kind of fries. My friend is a big fan of Red Robin which is why we came. The burger is not anything special and a bit pricey.

I'll admit, the service was much better from the last time I was there. I've never had a bad meal from Red Robin, but don't expect 5 star dining either. I love that it's located outside of the mall in a little outdoor shopping area. It's a great place to get away from the hustle and bustle of the mall, enjoy a decent meal and then get back to shopping. And even the alcoholic drinks are good! I was shocked at how strong mine was. I love shopping at the Santa Anita mall so I'll definitely come back here for a meal again.

Came here recently for a birthday party. Inside was like any other Red Robin. Clean and busy. Decided on the Blue Ribbon burger which has blue cheese, steak sauce, crispy onion straws, chiptole sauce with the usual lettuce and tomatos. I added bacon and a side of cole slaw. It was alright. I got my burger fix but nothing awesome about. It tasted better dipped with ranch.  Service was kinda slow. We had to track down our server a few times.

One of the worst service I've ever had. I know this location hasn't been open very long, but they trully do need to do something and teach their employees to attend to their customers a lot better. I've been at this restaurant three times since its opened and the service doesn't seem to get any better.  No silverware on the table, refills were hard to get...oh and not to mention, it was hard to find our server.  When I wanted to get my Red Robin Card credited I was told that I would have to call the business number and give them my info because they couldn't do it in the store.  Really... I guess I just won't go back, since this location is having such difficulties.

Went here for the first time with my cousin yesterday. It wasn't crowded yet when we were there. I ordered the freckled lemonade and it was really good. I also ordered the clucks and fries. The chicken tenders was good but there was nothing special about the fries. The waitress we had was polite and friendly. She checked in on us a few times to see how we were doing.

Ordered: -Guacamole bacon burger with endless steak fries -Mushroom swiss burger with brocoli Pros: -Service is FANTASTIC!! Everyone was so nice on a Saturday night.... even the manager came and asked how we were doing -Place is modern and clean Cons: -Burgers are tiny, as compared to Islands..... so I think they are slightly overpriced I have nothing much to say about this chain place..... besides the fact that I don't have any complaints about this place. Burgers are what you get. However, as stated above, I think the burgers are slightly overpriced and aren't worth the money. I'd rather go to Islands.

Guacamole bacon burger please!!!!!!!!!! I'm happy that they opened up at santa anita mall. I love coming here. I've tried several other burgers but my favorite is still the guacamole bacon burger, little pink, cut in half! I love that they have bottomless fries. they're sooooo delicious. The service at this location has been hit/miss depending on who you get.

I am very, very, very happy a Red Robin has opened closer to home. I love the burgers that Red Robin offers. They know how to make me happy! With the guacamole, mushrooms, Swiss cheese, it's like all the Hello Kitty in the world fitted into a burger! Okay... not really but still. I really like the Prime Chophouse and Guacamole Bacon Burger. Lucky for me, I can always order two burgers and get half of each because I have someone called a boyfriend! One of the best reasons for being in a relationship, I tell you.  Freckled lemonade and bottomless steak fries are another reason why I like Red Robin so much. Most people don't know but on the bottom there's other sides you can choose from instead of fries and those are bottomless as well. The onion ring tower is a must try. Comes with really good sauces. The Jalapeno coins are also a kicker.  The service here is very appreciated. The manager walks around and asks about your meal which is nice. Plenty of parking on a week night. It's on the second floor outside at the Promenade. Happy Hour Monday-Friday from 3PM-7PM, but at the bar only!!

Haven't been back in a few months and decided to return today to eat with friends. Now I remember why. 1. SERVICE: What's that?! The restaurant was more than half empty and we only saw our server once every 15 minutes. Our requests for boosters, refills, and check were forgotten and we spent an extra 30 minutes bobbing our collectives heads trying to find her.   2. FURNITURE: The tables are not fastened to the slippery floor so with children, it was sliding all over the place spilling food and bumping into people mid-bite.  3. BOTTOMLESS FRIES? Not really since we never saw our server and when we did, she didn't offer. There goes the appeal of RR. Since this RR is at our local mall, we may have to return there. If that happens, hopefully they'll earn a better review.

Service here sucks! Asked for no croutons on my salad...ended up getting the croutons ON MY SALAD. Asked for thousand island dressing got RANCH! Server never checked up on us he ended up spilling 2 strawberry lemonades right next to our table which stained my purse. Server was not apologetic at all! Other than the shitty service the food is good. Comes out on a timely manner and fries that come out are always hot! You gotta love the bottomless fries.

I've been to this Red Robin a couple times and everything has been good so far. The place isn't inside the mall, but outside in the Promenade area. Whenever I've been here, it doesn't get too busy where you have to wait to get seated so that's good for me! I've only stuck to the burgers here and every time, it comes out tasting good and how it's suppose to taste. Fries are also good as always, but I always find myself looking for those small crunchy ones. I go a little overboard with the seasoning, but hey I do like my food salty! Service has been good for us here too. Drinks may take a little while to get refilled and same with the fries, but other than that everything is pretty good.

Took my mom here for the first time. The food was good but the service was really bad. Had to wait over 20 minutes just to order the food because the server was no where to be found and even then, she took another 10 mins or so just to bring back the bottomless drinks and fries.

Came in for lunch on New Years Eve. 3 adults 3 kids. They did not have crayons for the kids and no lids for the kids drinks. We were worried to ask for napkins, thought they probably don't have those either. SMH.

So the munchkin was asking for a hamburger... for some reason she eschews cheeseburgers most of the time. Let alone we were on our way to go see Brave. So being the nice dad that I am, I took us over to red robin to grub.  Definitely a fun Daddy & Daughter day =) Well we arrived about 11:30am on a Saturday and lo and behold the joint was almost empty!!! We got immediately sat which is awesome when dealing with a munchkin to say the least! Pro Tip: Make sure to get the crayon pack for your kids. It is very good to share the coloring chores together Well I got a bacon cheeseburger and it was decent. It wasnt hideous nor was I going to confuse it with a top burger... but it was definitely able to hit the burger spot. The munchkin ate half of hers fairly quickly before filling up. So that is a good sign.  Pro Tip #2: The steak fries are bottomless, this is definitely a record that I didnt even eat all of the fries in my original basket. I used to get 3-5 baskets of them. Ohhhh how the metabolism changes you =\ I still definitely enjoy the french fries seasoning. Its great that they have a shaker of it on every table. Awesome! The service was decent and they even hooked up the munchkin with a balloon and that was a huge hit. She started smiling right then for ages when that happened. So average grub, good service (the manager even asked us how things were twice), and some good kid dinner favors made this an over all enjoyable service. I will be back as we have a gift card that isnt used up. Perhaps before another movie one of these days!

I remember I used to go to Red Robins a lot when I was a kid so I was happy to hear that they opened one up here. How does it live up? Well... to be honest it fell exactly where I thought it would it be: pretty decent. 3.5 FOOD QUALITY: If Red Robins is known for their burgers, then burgers I will have! I'm reminded of what their food was like years ago and I have to say it's consistent to what I remember.  The patty itself was moderately juicy; while the meat doesn't melt in your mouth it was still pretty good for what it's worth.  Straw onions itself were definitely not fresh and was not fried perfectly (or even fried enough since there was no crunch.)  For the Chophouse burger, I felt that the flavors were good and strong but a little bit too salty -- definitely a slight imbalance of flavors. I liked the burger overall. I wasn't very fond of the wedge cut fries since they were very inconsistent in texture.  SERVICE: Service was pretty nice, polite, and respectable. Food came out pretty quick since they weren't too busy.  ENVIRONMENT: It's new, it's clean, and it's pretty spacious. Lots of seating with, interestingly enough, a special bar area which I did not check out at all.  Overall, this place is pretty good but I don't think it's anything special. It's a good addition to what's already here and I can see myself coming back here if I'm craving for a burger that's conveniently around.

Red Robins has bottomless fries, some bottomless drinks, and even bottomless root beer float, which makes it pretty cool. It is on the pricer side.  I don't know how many fries people are consuming that it could possibly make up for the difference in price. They have a good assortment of burgers and sandwiches.  I got a Bruschetta Chicken Sandwich.  It was okay, but it didn't really have a bruschetta feel.  It had diced tomatoes, but it didn't have a toasted bun or the right sauce.  I could barely taste the pesto aioli, and the other brown sauce tasted funny.  (I'm guessing it was supposed to be balsalmic cream). My friend got the Fish Sandwich.  Hers was under-sauced, dry, and unflavorful.  She asked for extra tartar, which they gave. She also got the freckled lemonade, but they kept putting her strawberries on the bottom of a load of ice.  With the strange glass shape, it was a trying feat to fish out those berries! I do like how the waitresses are attentive, and they will refill before you even ask.

Red Robin is one of those restaurants that never gets old. I love the classic diner feel and they always have great food, even when they change up their menu. So I was pretty thrilled when they opened up a location at the Santa Anita Mall so I didn't have to always go to Glendale Galleria to get my Red Robin fix. It was pretty quiet for a Tuesday night, which was super nice. My friend and I really only shared the restaurant with four other small groups. The hostess quickly sat us at a booth and another staff member brought us water immediately. Quick service is always a plus. The stack of onion rings we got were deliciously warm and crisped to perfection. I love love love onion rings and Red Robin can do no wrong. I usually get a wrap or sandwich but I decided to try and be "good" so I got the Whiskey BBQ Chicken Salad. It was pretty good, lots of yummy flavors. Only complaint was that the salad was drowned, and I mean DROWNED, in the dressing. Like I said, it was still delicious, but possibly a little too much. I also had a skinny margarita. I'm generally skeptical of "skinny" drinks because it generally means they will either be watered down, or just juice. This one pleasantly was neither. It tasted like a real margarita. All in all, I'm glad I have a closer Red Robin to go to now.
Decent, the burgers are okay so are the drinks. Service is pretty good.

Every time I visit this place, I always regret that I have come again. It is not about their food. It's their service. Food came with no napkins. We had to ask for them. No not for extra napkins. My daughter's salad came with no fork. Since when has salad become a finger food? Were the servers too busy to notice? I guess: They were too busy laughing out loud among themselves and chatting each other to pay attention to their customers. I counted, and there were 13 employees all at or around the kitchen area. Only 6 tables were occupied.  I happened to sit where I could have a full view of their kitchen. Used red straws were scattered all over their tile floor. Plastic wrappings fell to the floor from an overstuffed trash can but no one cared to pick them up. Used wet napkins were all over the floor too. I had to fight my urge to take a picture and upload their kitchen floor. Well, this will be my first and last comment on this restaurant. Never going back.

Classic American burger joint that always leaves you too full to be comfortable!  With its endless fries and bottomless drinks, this place never lets me go without making me feel like I really ought to hit the gym. Food: their burgers are made to order.  You can get your patties done in medium so they aren't nice little hockey pucks when they get to you.  With so many varieties, it's hard to just pick one.  I like the classic burger, with everything loaded.  My gluten-free friend can get theirs wrapped with a thick layer of lettuce so it doesn't fall apart.  And for a place that does burgers, they make excellent Fish & Chips.  Light batter, fluffy white fish... good to the last bite with a dash of malt vinegar.   Drinks: they have a full bar with all the mixers.  Most other drinks are pretty much bottomless.  The Freckled Strawberry Lemonade is absolutely divine.  But if you want a dessert, root beer floats are always bottomless and it's done with Barq's.   I can't tell you what's on the dessert menu because I'm always too full to try anything at the end of the meal.  (Especially if I have anything to start, hummus plate is really good.)   Service: I've never had bad service here and I usually go at nights and weekends.  The waiters are hurried but attentive, friendly and responsive to requests.  This place is great if you just want to chill and enjoy company and food.  Or for the boys, there's massive TV's with sports playing at all angles of the place.

I went here for my 21st birthday and my waitress was really sweet and did a great job taking care of our large party. However, there was one bartender who was super creepy and i had an embarrassing necklace on that said i was 21 and i went into the bar area and he totally made me feel uncomfortable saying that if i dont have my ID then i wont be getting a drink and i was just looking around and it was super creepy and awkward and rude...and i was lik"ok?" like so freakish and weird....don't go there for the bar hes rude! Go for the unlimited fries to be honest!

It was good up until we ordered our desert.. we happened to be sitting in plain view of the kitchen and we just happen to see the person getting our desert with her hands she had her whole hand on the cheesecake and then to top it off she droppes it then picks it right up and puts her whole hand on the cheesecake serves it up and the waitress brings it to our table.. at this point we didn't want it we told the waitress and she told her manager and he comes and talks to us and tells us that the california state health dept doesnt have a problem with them touching the food.. we were like t ou don't have a spatula to get the cheesecake he was like no.... ummm yeah no thank you I don't think I'll be eatting at red robins ever again... they don't were gloves and drop your food and pick it right up and serve it to you... I guess if you don't see it you don't know... but I saw it and I do know... all the manager said was sorry.... to late for that.... nasty and disgusting I can just imagine how they handle their food. So dissappointed :-( maybe I should call the health department and have them check how they handle their food...

This is the worst Red Robin I have ever been too. The servers are terrible! So first the hostess that greeted us was really nice and she was very pleasant with every guest but it all went downhill once we got seated.  It took about 10 mins before our server ever came around to even acknowledge we were there. Once she came to the table we immediately told her what drinks we wanted and what food we wanted. Me and my friend each ordered a burger which comes with bottomless fries. We requested to get the fries first. The best servers at Red Robin usually offer this to their clients since you get as many fries as you want might as well eat some while your waiting for your burger.  About 20 minutes later, no food and no drinks. Instead our server comes to tell us that she lost our order and that she will have to retake it. Really?! Where did our order just go? And it took you 20 minutes to figure out that our order just disappeared. Her excuse was that we aren't really her table and that she was just helping another server that will be right with us. Girl you did not help him at all.  So our server finally comes with our drinks and our bottomless fries first. No joke he only gave us one basket with 10 pieces of fries. Yes we counted them! In about 3 minutes we finished our 10 pieces of fries and our lemonades. Our server never bothered coming back to our table until our food was ready. He must have been scared of us because we had appalled looks on our faces.  All in all it was a terrible dining experience.  Never coming here again!

Unlimited fries with any burger combo order! Ask for the extra order of fries when you put your order in because they only give you a small handful of fries. It was a little hard to flag down the waiter for water but the food was good. The burgers was cooked well and the bread was fresh. The taste of the burgers isn't amazing but its a nice sit down restaurant to go to. They have delicious appetizers and many cool mixed drinks. I personally enjoy their seasoning on their fries the most!

The food was really good, lets start with that.  I took off 3 stars for the service that we received when we were there on Sunday.  Started out we were placed in a section that hadn't been staffed yet, so we waited, and waited, and waited so more for a server to greet us.  When she did, no apology for the wait.  We ordered, as we had already memorized the menus in that amount of time.  Very quick to bring out our tea, someone else brought our food to us, my boyfriends tea glass was empty for about 5 minutes before she came and refilled it, mine was empty too, by that time, but she ignored mine, and I was never offered a refill.   That's the reason I took 3 stars off.  The food was really good though....wish I could have tipped the cook!!!!!!

I came to this restuarant on a friday night with two of my friends. I order a burning love and told the waitress i dont want any tomatoes in my meal. She says okay so I'm like great! When my meal came out all you see was tomatoes and she's like there tomatoes. What part of I didn't want tomatoes did the waitress not understand? She looked at me like you can jist take it out and I look at her with a face give me a brand new one. I told you no tomatoes. The service here is the worst ever!

Our service was really bad. Our waiter, Samantha was inattentive. She got our burger wrong and when I asked her for a new one she gave me attitude. Overall food was whatever. Our server had terrible service.  All the servers and hostess don't smile, give you a rude attitude when you ask for something. Def not coming back here anytime soon.

Hrm, I don't know why this place has poor reviews, but I hope I don't find out! I visited this place for the first time yesterday with a party of 16 at 6:00 P.M., our servers being Lupita and Fox.  They first took our drink orders so that we had at least something to sip on while waiting for our food. There was a bit of a wait, but what can you expect? You can't get 16 burgers at the same time, not to mention there were other people in the restaurant as well! FOOD: I ordered the Guacamole Bacon Burger. It was good, but there wasn't much guac and what was on there was more of a dark green, maybe they needed to make a new batch of guac? SERVICE: Hostess was a sweeheart! Our servers were so attentive and fulfilled all of our needs in no time whether it was a request for ranch/barbeque, more refills on our drinks, or those fresh hot bottomless fries! Our servers were wonderful and friendly as can be. Fox especially, had an upbeat attitude and was really entertaining that night, we were not expecting that. LOL Good food and good company equals a thumbs up from me!
Great food, but service quality at 8pm in Sunday was very poor. Not what I usually experience at red robin
Good food but baaaad customer service!... Servers always take long to attend you once your seated, and don't even know about the deals or promotions going on....

This update is long overdue. We frequent this location for late night happy hour from 8pm-close.  SERVICE - 3/5 Still nothing special and don't expect fast service in the bar area. FOOD - 3/5 Their burgers aren't as great as Islands, but their bottomless steak fries make up for it. My normal burger selections are narrowed down to a few: the one with pepper, the Berseker (Wolverine movie inspired) and the bruschetta chicken sandwich.  A new discovery is that they make garlic fries with Parmesan!!  OVERALL - 3/5 I will definitely come back for happy hour, mainly because it's not crowded! Pro Tip: Sign up for their royalty rewards and get special email offers. I redeemed my birthday burger last month! Yelp 100 Challenge 2013 - 47 of 100

Have eaten here a few times but this last time compelled me to write something. I ordered to go... and yes, it took a while longer than they estimated.  But when I got home, one order was missing.  As soon as I called, the manager (Lisa) already knew that it occurred, told me she credited me back the entree, and made it right.  They had even tried calling the number associated with the royalty card but since we screen out telemarketers, we hadn't picked up.  This customer service action impressed me.  Now if everyone was like Lisa... Just sharing...

I've gone here several times since it opened up, including today, and the customer service has always sucked. Our waiter walked by us several times, looked at our table ,saw our drinks were low and never filled them once or asked us how our food was, until after we finished our meal. Like really? They also seem to be understaffed. Their food is usually just subpar, sometimes good though. Last time i went, i ordered a side of side of southwest black beans, but they tasted like they were just opened out of a can poured right there, just regular. The burger was alright. This time i got the new bezerk burger, it was very tasty, but not spicy. My mom got the whisky chicken burger and it barely had any bbq sauce or toppings. My side of coleslaw just tasted like plain cabbage, So.

Damn! I never thought I would see Red Robin under 4 stars! You guys are harsh! lol Well anyways, I have always been a fan of Red Robin! If there is a Red Robin in the area, you know I'm thinking about eating there or I'm suggesting to eat there. My go to burger is the Whiskey River BBQ burger. Sooo LEGIT!  If i'm not feeling the burger, I get the Whiskey River BBQ Chicken wrap or the Fish and Chips. Both also legit and will not disappoint you! Get some garlic fries with ranch on the side and a strawberry lemonade and you have a satisfying meal. I also see on the menu that you can now substitute stuff out for healthier choices. That is always a good thing Price: Between $10-$15. Worth it FOR SURE! Service: Service is alright. I feel like it could be a little better since it is not too busy up in there. But it'll do. Parking: Easy to find parking in the mall/promenade parking lot. Will I be back? Hell yeah! They always seem to have some deals on alcohol that I can't pass up. lol. And those damn garlic fries! Can never say no to those!

This location is close by where we live so fortunately we enjoy coming here. We've been here on 3 separate occasions and have never had bad service. The restaurant is at the Arcadia mall so parking isn't really an issue, especially if you park right near the stairs going up to the 2nd level. The interior of the restaurant is bright and cheery.  The bar is located in the back of the restaurant and there are TV's if you want to watch a game. We usually order the Bleu Ribbon burger or the Whiskey BBQ burger with the bottomless fries.  Both burgers are great and the fries are good too.  They have their own seasonings on the tables in case you want to add extra. So, no complaints here.  I hope we continue to get the same good service we've gotten in the past.

My family and I came this passed weekend, we ordered the artichoke dip to start, which I didn't try..but everyone else who did got realllllyyy bad food poisoning. I felt fine, so it had to be that. My whole family was so sick. It was awful. We should've known when we received it cold--the cheese wasn't even melted. Everything else was good, including the service. I will not be returning.

Located at the Outdoor area of the Westfield mall near Macy's. I have been there 6 times.  Their foods good.  Enjoyed all the different types of burgers they have.  Love the endless steak fries.   But every time, at this location at least, the service is poor.   Unless you have all the time in the world. I wouldn't go there if your hungry because the servers are nice but they are super super slow serving the food and it's hard to get their attention for refills.   In fact it took about 20 mins to have them serve a cup of soup.  Which by the way the chicken tortia soup was pretty good.   So unless I have more time and have a craving for some burgers, I guess I would go back.
The food there was delicious it waa like tasting a piece of heaven ot was that good I would go back

So... I really should not be allowed into establishments that serve "bottomless" anything. Why? Because I have no self control -_- Jin C. and I came here for lunch last Sunday. And I ordered the following: BOTTOMLESS FRECKLED LEMONADE: The drink that made us delicious. And famous. -- This is their famous strawberry lemonade, but unfortunately it was not as "freckled" as I had remembered it being. They were being skimpy on the strawberries :( But it was still good, and I made sure to take advantage of it being "bottomless" by getting two refills. WHISKEY RIVER BBQ BURGER: Our smoky, tangy tribute to the Wild West. We roped together our signature bourbon-infused Whiskey River BBQ Sauce, crispy onion straws, Cheddar, tomatoes and mayo. Comes with Bottomless Fries. -- Tastes just as good as it sounds. I meant to only eat half of it so that I could focus on my fries, but our server was late with the fries so I ended up eating the whole thing :( I enjoyed it though! BOTTOMLESS FRIES: Came with our requested sauces of Ranch and Honey Poppyseed (basically honey mustard). (Ketchup is already at the table.) -- These were my downfall. They are steak fries, fresh and piping hot! Jin C. had also ordered a burger (I don't even remember what it was any more) so she also had bottomless fries. So when we requested refills, they brought out a large basket for us to share. Our eyes were bigger than our stomachs and we got three refills. Yeah... that was a mistake. Don't do that if you're just in a group of two. We regretted it in the end because we were so uncomfortabley full -_- The food here is pretty good and the service is okay. Our server didn't come by very often though, so it felt like every single time we saw him we were requesting a refill of something (either fries or drink). But he was really nice so it was fine. The restaurant is large, easy to find (in the Promenade by Macy's), and has clean bathrooms. Overall it's a decent option for a meal with friends, but I personally am going to try to avoid coming here because I have self control issues :P

Two of my co-workers and I went in during our lunch break on a Sunday - it was not busy but not empty either. We walked to the bar section because service is usually a bit quicker there and sat down, a server quickly asked what we wanted to drink . . . then we waited . . . and waited . . . during the 15 minutes of us sitting there, the bartender was making drinks at the bar, ringing people up, and obviously, not getting our drinks.  Ready to complain, my friend/co-worker flagged down a woman who looked like a manager - she happened to be holding our drinks (this was now about 20 minutes after we placed a drink order). We told her we were on a lunch break and haven't even placed our order yet, she wrote down everything then talked about the Royalty card, etc. About 15 minutes pass and our food arrives (which normally isn't bad but is when you have already waited for 20 minutes).   - Spinach and artichoke dip was COLD.  - My friend asked for no jalapeños on her chili fries only to find them in there and proceeded to try and pick out each diced jalapeño.  - My other friend said her clam chowder was not good at all but she was hungry and we were out of time so she ate it.  At that point, friend #1 asked for the manager and explained what was wrong. About the jalapeños, the manager had the nerve to say "well, you ordered like you knew what you were getting so I thought you didn't want the jalapeños on top but knew they were diced in the chili." ...Seriously ??? Trying to put the blame on the customer ? What a joke. Just apologize, ask if there is anything you can do, and take it off the bill without having to be asked. Needless to say, my friend said she would need a credit back to her account because she wasn't going to pay for it (we had paid while eating). The manager disappeared and never came back !! Ten minutes later, we then had to ask the original server to get a manager - a shorter, blonde woman came over to us. She was a perfect example of what the other manager should have done from the beginning - very apologetic and didn't blame anything on us, also explained that the other manager got her shirt dirty and was embarrassed. I think her name was Leslie - I truly don't recall though.   Overall, I have had decent experiences in the past - never great, but always nice - and this one was just horrible. It went wrong on all types of levels. Maybe it was a bad day or we just had bad luck . . . not sure which but we regretted our choice of going there for lunch. One star because my food was fine and that second manager was lovely.

Good service, but the pictures they use for their menu must have been taken through a magnifying glass. Their burgers are so small I don't see any reason why they continue to have a children's menu, which should probably be changed to a selection of infant formula instead.

One star for the food. That's it. When we got there our table had NOT been cleaned. The server at the bar looked at me and said "the tables not cleaned" after standing there for almost five minutes the poor busboy cleans it. Meanwhile the server was standing there chit chatting. Whatever no big deal. However it took us 15 minutes to flag someone down to order. After we ordered we waited nearly 30 minutes for our food. Never again did I see the server Til it was time to get the bill. Would I ever done there again? HELL NO! Not even bottomless fries will bring me back there.
over priced Burger place I rather eat at IN N OUT quality... okay service.... average but most of the time i was ignored not coming here
