Always loved red robin!  Freckled lemonade + bottomless fries!  I came here craving a burger and went for the shroom burger.  Just as good as I remembered it.  I also like the crispy chicken burger here as well as the wraps and soups!  Either way its a chain restaurant so you know exactly what you'll be getting! The service here was good, fast and polite.  Parking is in the mall.  They have a pretty good happy hour here as well!

Overall, a decent place to dine on burgers and milkshakes.  They customize burgers with Gardenburger, Boca, and even gluten-free bread for those who are inclined.  A major bonus (curse?) is that some of their items come with "bottomless" steak fries.   Service was okay, ambiance was fine, and milkshake wasn't incredible but they have a good selection.  It's a good pre- or post-movie place to dine, though on the other side of the mall.

God bless, our waitress, Lucille for having to tolerate my friend the night we went.  Location: it's attached to the Westfield Mall. The way the location looks is almost like Pasadena's outdoor mall where Arclight Theaters is located. Very clean.  Atmosphere: we got there at 9, so it was pretty dead. Not many people dining in, so it was quiet. The restaurant itself looked very well-kept. Had lots of seating.  Food: I ordered the Big Robin Burger (or something like that) with Cheddar. Wow! The burger was really flavorful. I don't know if it's because I haven't been there in a long time that I don't remember it tasting that good, or if they changed up the seasonings to the meat patty, or they just cook it differently in this specific location, but that burger was amazing. Fries were good (can't go wrong with bottomless fries); I just wish it was a little crispier.  Service: Lucille was amazing. She was sweet, really peppy, helpful and was EXTREMELY patient with my friend. How patient? My friend made an order of water complicated, I kid you not. I was so embarrassed. Anyway, she was able to play off my friend's order and was super cool about everything. Trust me when I say that you will be in great hands if she waits on you.

My girlfriend and I like to come her for a burger. They always offer great service but tonight it was the worst I ever had at any restaurant. When we were seated our waitress Lisa came to our table with a look and didn't greet and ask what you want. When she brought our food she just slammed it on the table and walked away. Our drinks were empty and didn't bother to ask for a refill and she walked away so quick to ask for a refill. In the middle of us enjoying our burgers, she comes to our table and drops off the check and walks away without saying anything. My girlfriend was actually wanting dessert but I guess Lisa didn't want to serve us. The only two good things of our visit was that the food was good and the manager Tim was walking around and talking to customers. We had a nice chat about football playoffs.

Terrible, please don't come here. Worst service, server with a creative "mouth", non food items in our food, poor bar tending, if I could give a zero I would. Sad thing is the manager couldn't even help the situation. Boo red robin where did the fun go?

This is my first time ever coming to Red Robin and it was a good experience. Our waitress was nice and friendly. I ordered the smokin' pepper for about $10. I don't think there was anything special about the burger. I thought it was a good tasting burger, but at the same time I don't think I've ever had a burger that completely wow'd me (Umami only). The bottomless fries are nice and I mainly pigged out on that.
Their burgers, southwest salad, peach ice tea, and tortilla soup are the best!

Dined in for lunch yesterday. We for the burning love and western swiss. Not too sure if the second burger is called that.  The burgers tasted alright, but was pricy for the quality.  The burgers came with bottomless steak fries and bottomless steamed broccoli.  The fries where a bit dry and the broccoli was flavorless. For drinks, we ordered a lemonade and margurita. The lemonade was way too sweet and the margurita barely contained any alcohol. The food and drinks deserve two stars. The one star is for the terrible service. Clearly the place is under staff. We barely got to see our waiter. We waited 20 minutes before seeing our waiter to take our order.  Food came in 10 minutes,  which is pretty good. The upsetting part of our meal is trying to have our sides refilled.  Our server ignore my table when we tried to get refills on our bottomless items. We had to wave him down and wait another 20 minutes for them to "cook" the items.  Towards the end of our meal our waiter completely ignored us. He only to came to take the check... which they forgot to apply my reward card.  Overall, pricy food and horrible service means I'm never coming here again.

This review is solely based on the service. Our waitress becca clearly didn't want to serve anyone especially us. Every time she would walk past she would look the other way or go all the way around us. We had to ask other waiters to refill our drinks. She then would get irritated that we asked other people. There were only like 6 tables and 4 other waiters and she couldn't handle the one table. I would suggest going to another red robins or staying away from becca. The food was decent but service one of the worst I have ever had .
For being a mall joint it's still a good place to eat. The service is fast and friendly. Quick drink refills, food comes out within a good time..
I love this place. I think everyone should try Red Robins. Red's Nantucket Seafoood Platter with my Heineken is bliss!!!

This Red Robin has never let me down. The food is always delicious and I get an annoyingly high number of refills on my freckled lemonades. But I have to give them the stars because as a fast(er) food place, the wait is terrible! Especially when waiting for fry refills, which is the sell for the franchise. But everything else, the food, the service, the restrooms, are all great. I just hate waiting before I eat a massive amount of food.

Red Robin is now my "dine-in" restaurant at the Santa Anita Mall. Why? 1) The "Bottomless" options on the menu are great! Everyone knows about the bottomless steakfries that comes with an order of a burger. But what about the bottomless floats? Bottomless lemonades? And my new favorite: bottomless broccoli! You can substitute your bottomless fries for steamed broccoli instead, and that's what I did. Sounds a little crazy, but if you're there with someone who is going to get bottomless fries already, why not switch it up? You can also substitute the steakfries with other options too, but some are with an additional fee.  2) Burgers are yummy. I got the Whiskey River BQQ burger cooked to medium, and it was really flavorful. They were generous with the crispy onion straw too. The buns were toasted in a lot of grease, sadly to say. Good thing I had steamed broccoli to balance it out a bit! 3)The environment is nice. I like the location of it (in the Promenade); it makes for a more intimate experience just being away from all the window shoppers within the mall. The service is great too, with really friendly employees. The waiters and waitresses are pretty good at refilling drinks and bottomless fries as well. Unfortunately, they don't have happy hour at this RR location anymore. Bummer.

I am rating the service, not the food - since I never got to taste it!   If it weren't for the fact that I saw a couple tables occupied I would think the place was not open yet - no hostess in site when we walked in.  After about 10 minutes she came from the back and seated us - after about 10 minutes I asked a girl bussing the tables if I could please order and she said our server would be over soon - we walked out after about another 10 minutes and I think nobody ever even noticed - lol!  lots of other choices at the mall

I tried the Riblets and Mac & Cheese combo. The riblets were actually good, but the portion size is somewhat on the small side (for the price of the dish, at least). The Texas toast was decent. The mac & cheese was adequate, although I've definitely had better elsewhere. The "coleslaw" was actually rather vile ... I would rank it below any other coleslaw I have tried. It was dry, coarsely chopped, and made me feel like a bunny eating raw cabbage. To be frank, I would even rather have the soggy coleslaw served by KFC. Seriously Red Robin, if you don't know how to properly make coleslaw, simply take it off your menu. Or just commit Seppuku, whatever. I also tried the Clucks & Shrimp plate. The chicken tenders and shrimp were both decent, but again ... portion sizes that were rather small for the price of the plate. See a pattern here yet? The bottomless steak fries were pretty good. The bottomless "Very Berry Raspberry Limeade" was actually surprisingly good and refreshing. In general, the food here seems to be priced on the high side for the quality/quantity of what is served. The service was attentive but *INSANELY* overbearing, and tasting somewhat of insincerity. On one hand, I never had to get anyone's attention to get my bottomless beverage refilled, and I don't remember ever lacking for anything at the table. As a result, I can't say that this service here unqualifiably sucked. On the other hand, It seemed like a different waitress was asking me "everything OK?" every 2 minutes ... and worse, not even *seeming* like they really gave a shit whether I said "yes" or "no", but more like they were just going through the motions (I probably should have seen that coming the moment I realized the staff seemed to be comprised exclusively of Valley Girls. By the way, I *love* Valley Girls ... I just haven't had the best experiences with them as my waitresses. YMMV.). Seeing the check brought to my table before I asked for it was the final faux pas that made me realize this would probably be my final visit here. Seriously, I can't stand restaurants with this type of "service". The restaurant is rather noisy due to the sports bar and TVs. Given that the place is located at the mall, the parking situation is not the best. Overall, I don't see myself coming back here ... it's definitely not the worst place I've ever eaten at (Gin Sushi of Pasadena currently holds that dubious distinction), but there's just too many other restaurants in the area offering better overall food/service/value.
I'm sorry to say that the food service is very slow and the food is always cold. The staff is nice. 've been here half a dozen times since they opened and have their loyalty card.

On a Wednesday we waited 20 mins to get seated and when we walked in there were empty seats so we didn't understand why the wait was so long and than we waited 20 mins to get our food after we ordered. The burgers were bland and the plates that the burgers are on are so small. The only thing good was the onion rings. I wouldn't recommend this place or at least this location.

I do not get my jollies over what today's moronic world labels gourmet food.  Like oh boy oh boy I have a fried egg on my burger!! I have to call mommy!  Must be a ME generation thing. Nothing really to write home about here.  Endless fries -who cares..how many can you eat. I am skinny with a small stomach, so all I need is a handful. Had a regular over-priced cheeseburger, that was like a frozen patty... and not much flavor. Mall food at its finest that's for sure. Service was good enough for me, but not sure if I'll ever eat here again.
Good place to eat especially since I worked near by

The group from work decided on going to a happy hour yesterday and picked Red Robin. What a mistake! The happy hour is from 4p -6p!  Why doesn't it go to 7p like every other restaurant? The place was practically void of any people and yet the service was awful! We had a group of about 20 with only one server. Drinks were ordered around 530 and had didn't arrive till 550 and when we asked the manager about ordering a couple extra drinks before happy hour ended we were told no, that we would have to finish the current drink before they would serve another, which means you could not order two extra drinks at the happy hour price to save a few bucks! The food was good which is a shame because reading most of the reviews it's the service that will cause people not to return. Hopefully the owner of this particular restaurant reads reviews because I don't think the manager cared very much!
The service was really good for a first time visit, the waiter recommended a really good soup. A baked potato soup very delicious! You should defiantly try it here!

Craptastic service! DO NOT waste your time unless you have time to waste. Place is dead but service is even deader!!! Watched our food sit under the heat lamp for no less than 20 minutes. Tim, the GM is obviously oblivious to the crappy service as he was slinging food all over the kitchen area. Waitress was nice but no time management skills with her job. This place probably lost a customer!

This review is for a to go order. Service was friendly but slow. Food is way overpriced for the amount you get. Hardly any fries came with my burger. My boyfriend ordered a wrap but they gave him regular bread instead and we didn't notice till we got home.  Also, we ordered a slice of strawberry cheesecake and it was small for the price ($6- rip off)

Just had a bad experience at this red robin. Food sat under the heat lamps for almost 10 minutes.  My meal was waiting for a salad. Fries were cold and 2 of the 3 meals were wrong. We sat close to the kitchen area where we could see them get the plates and the staff was just screwing around. We will never be back to this location at the Santa Anita mall.

I don't understand why people don't like this place. Bottomless fries, cold beer, good burgers and very friendly service. What's not to like? I am here probably 2-3 times per week and have yet to have bad service or a bad meal. I love the veggie options for when I'm eating a little better and just the fact that I can get things lettuce wrapped and have a bottomless side salad means that I get to eat well when I'm eating good.  The beef is good the chicken is good and and bacon is always good. Love the royal burger, the banzai, the simple chicken sandwich, the Ensenada chicken platter and fiery ghost style adds a good amount of tongue tingling action to my lunch.  Drop by and give it a shot. It's worth it!

Always excellent service when we dine at this location. I don't understand the negative reviews. We were seated right away, placed our order shortly after. Food came out pretty quick. Tasted good. Overall nothing bad to say about this visit or location.

Food was average,  nothing that spectacular.  Only problem is when you are offered bottomless fries as part of the menu and the waiter asks if you would like more yet forgets to bring them??? And the purpose of offering is????   When my wife reminded him about the fries, the response was "they didn't bring them" ?  Who?  Was the manager supposed to bring them?  It was the waiter that asked us if we wanted more fries.   On a side note,  it was a Wednesday evening and it wasn't that busy so there isn't any excuse.

So usually my friends and I go to red robins a lot to eat at the mall. We had gotten great services. But one day, my friends and I wanted more fries and they are bottomless "unlimited fries including the burger you get, right? So the first time it was free since it's unlimited but after we finished the fries, we wanted more & my friend had asked our waiter again for more fries, the waiter glared at the both of us, which we felt was sorta odd because we felt she started getting annoyed asking for more. And she later gave us the checks, and said she charged 1 pound for the fries because it's a new policy for them since we ordered again more fries  and we thought it was stupid when the fries were unlimited fries, so we could get as much as we wanted. I felt like I should gotten my money back since I didn't get my money worthy that day. But what do you guys think if this has or already has happened to you?

I went with my family lastnight there and what a disappointment and a frustrating dinner. My mom ordered a shake and when it came to the table the glass was broken so we asked the server to make a new one and can you believe she poured the shake from the broken glass into another glass and returned it. How stupid the server is and we talked to the manager and he isn't worth shit he had an excuse for everything we brought to his attention he belongs working at mc Donald's as a manager he's completely clueless of what it takes to manage a restaurant. We will not visit this place again the server had a bad attitude

Nice server but it took forever for our drinks and then our food arrived and the burger and fries were cold.  Sent it back no problem.  Got the burger which was hot this time. No fries .... Then the fries came like 15 min later.  Again our server was nice but the food was not good and it took forever

WOW!!! Is all I have to say!..... But wait this is a WOW as in how bad could my service and cold food be. I see the host come from the kitchen area since she was leaning and chatting with my oblivious future server. Greets me with the ever so friendly "Hey, How ya doing?, just one today?" Yes I came to eat alone and enjoy some quiet thanks for making it seem like a bad thing. My reward was to be sat next to a crying child when the entire restaurant had about 4 tables being used.  That was the warm up before the real show began! The server came and seemed welcoming so my hopes improved, I ordered a Black n Bleu burger because I was hungry and it looked delicious in the picture. Trouble is that is where the delicious stopped. My burger came out after about 15minutes and was burnt into a mouth watering hockey puck instead of the medium rare I asked for. I explained the  problem to my server to see her amazingly blank stare of wonder. She said "So Sorry" grabbed my burger and walked away.  She came back with a basket of fries for me to "munch on" (her words) and the burger followed another 10 minutes later, luckily I had an hour lunch. This time the burger came and the patty looked good, too bad they used the same bun which was cold, soggy and difficuly to hold. I could not spare anymore time for this wonderful service so I ate and the flavors were great. Would have been better if made to be as wonderful as the picture but oh well... lesson learned. After 45min and a $18 bill later I had a soggy but flavorful burger. Would have rather have eaten a Double Double.  Keep up the "WOW" service Red Robin Arcadia!

This place is mediocre at best.  There is a good environment and the onion rings are delicious. The service is wonderful!! Staff always attends to your every need. There is also their patented "bottomless" steak fries, which are okay. I'd still prefer in and out fries and mcdonalds over this. The only good thing is that its unlimited, yet they give you a small container to start off and so by the time you get your fries you'd be full. I had the prime rib dip sandwich, which came with cole slaw. It wasn't anything I expected ~ the bread was dry and the meat was a bit too salty.  Their onion rings are good.  Their chicken burger was a tad bit dry, I wouldn't order it again. I probably wouldn't come back. Unless I was craving endless fries. Although I give them an A for effort, the burgers are still nothing like the pictures.

Cool middle of the road option for when you need to grab a bite at the mall but don't want to have to battle for a spot at the food court or drop a ton on lunch at Benihana's/Wood Ranch/cheese Cake factory.  They offer the standard burgers & sandwiches - all of which have been pretty tasty. Love the bottomless steak fries as well.

of course, like all chains,  service is mediocre.  our water didn't come until we mentioned it again.  they served someone who came in after us.  I guess if you dont spend money on drinks, they'll take their sweet time getting it to you. got the western smokehouse burg, brother got the one with the egg and bacon.  both are again, mediocre.  fries with the seasoning was a bit above average.  overall, the meal was not worth the $22.  average quality ingredients.  if you want to spend that much go to Grill Em' All.  Even In n Out uses higher quality ingredients.

Food was really good. Service, not so much. Took forever to get the food and once we wanted more "bottomless fries" it took 20 min to get them. If youre a manager, get on your staff pal. But, food was good so I guess thats all that matters
Courteous service. Abundant Space. Food quality/portion is good. Price is acceptable. Red Robin burger w/ fries + lemonade drink + tax + tip = $16.00

ok, so i am naive b/c i trust the photo of the new Collosus burger. I was shocked when it came. it looks more like a Carl's Jr. burger......yea, you get bottomlessfries but really, how many fries can one handle? Even my teenagers didn't get a refill...personally, i think hook's burger is better and cheaper and their fries has no gmo and it tastes sooooo good. thye call it goumet buger so I really expect a lot so truly, I was disappointed. so unless you need to watch sport tv while eating, it is not worth the extra buck...

Kinda of a blah burger joint in a busy mall. It is good for the bar scene but the food is mediocre at best. Decent kids menu and the bottomless riblets are what keep me coming back.  I think they have a decent happy hour at their nice sized bar.

It's really a great place to grab something to eat. The environment is friendly, the food is good, and the service is cool. If you want great service ask for Brian! He's cute, friendly, and he gets you what you need. I know I'll be coming back!

So surprised over the low reviews because very time we go to RR, our food and service is great...plus they're great supporters of Special Olympics! Yesterday the kids enjoyed the kids cheeseburgers, the hubby had the red robin cheeseburger and I had the chicken bruschetta. The RR burger was nicely cooked, just a tad punk inside, and the fixings layered and noticeable. My chix sandwich was delicious and enjoyed the creamy pesto sauce that compliments the tomato and herb topping.

I recommend the West Covina location. It's also in a Westfield mall. The service there is generally good and they hook it up there a lot of times, and I don't even have any connections there.   Service is at minimum, they may or may not greet you at all, or even look at you. Their restroom is much better than the West Covina location, I'll give them that.  (See pic) My grilled chicken patty had charred particles! Although the taste of the other elements covered it up, it didn't cover it up entirely. My patty looked like it got burnt so someone tried to save it by scraping as much off as possible OR the grill wasn't cleaned so black bits are all over my patty.  And bottomless fries. Enough said.

OMG!!! And not in a good way!! So my kids wanted to check this place out and decided why not, Big Mistake!! I should have turned right around when we walked in and saw the host getting yelled at by an angry customer, we decided to get seated anyway. Our waitress comes over and she was very nice, 10 minutes later she comes back with our drinks and spills my daughters milk shake all over the table, she apologizes and comes back with napkins so we can clean it up!! WTF!!! I was willing to overlook this and figured she must be new or they are probably really short handed since I saw the host running around seating people and cleaning tables.. I thought maybe the food will be really good and will make up for the little mishaps, I WAS WRONG!! The food was disgusting!! I ordered a Caesar chicken wrap and the chicken looked and tasted like hard boiled egg! I couldn't eat it, my kids didn't touch their food either! It was a total waste of money and time, we would have been better off going to Topps down the street and I would have saved myself some money too! Lesson learned, never again!

We came for the endless fries however it takes forever to get them and they only give like a handful, well that tactic works because by the second time of asking for fries you are full and frankly you don't want to wait for them.  We sat right by the window where they picked the fires and I think everyone encountered the same thing..   The hamburgers were not so memorable that I would have to come back here. If you're in the mall there are plenty of other food places to choose from.
Just a light breakfast for me today... CHILI CHEESE FRIES Chili, cheese, jalapenos and bacon is part of my balanced breakfast. Don't judge.

This restaurant is alright. It's kind of just like another burger place. Nothing too special. For the price? Not that good. I would advise people to just get burgers from In N Out! Good price and good burgers. But if you want to be served, then come here! They have good strawberry lemonade too! But nothing special. Wouldn't come here too often.  Plus: They have bottomless fries!!! And drinks!

I'm so disappointed with our recent trips to this Red Robin. I love Red Robin and I have for years but this is the worst one I've ever been to. On a recent visit, a waitress flat out refused to bring us fries before our meal. No real explanation, I think she just didn't want to. Terrible first impression. Which brings me to tonight...  We didn't wait long to be seated (bad sign on a Friday night) and once we were at our table, we had enough time to browse the menu and pick our food out before even seeing our waiter. He took our entire order and then we waited 15 minutes for our drinks and fries. I had to ask for sauce for my fries 3 times to 2 different people before I got it (at the end of my meal). We sat right next to the kitchen. I think they should get rid of those tables because no one should be forced to watch their food under a heat lamp for 20 minutes.  Why bother with bottomless anything because we barely got refills on our drinks and fries. Food came out warm and all the fries were cold. Getting hot fries was impossible, never once were they fresh and hot. We watched tons of waiters and the manager just stand around chatting and laughing while 6 trays of food sat under the heat lamps. We saw out waiter about 3 times total, all night. So unacceptable, we won't be back here again. Sucks because this is so close to home but I'd rather drive to West Covina, their service is 100 times better.  Get it together Santa Anita Red Robin!!!! If you're thinking of coming here, don't bother.

WORST SERVICE EVER. Avoid this Red Robin at all costs, unless you enjoy watching your food sit ready to go at the kitchen for 20 minutes next to the entire restaurants' orders. This was the third straight time we've eaten there where no one was doing anything. No one was running food, the manager was running around doing nothing, had to beg for drink refills, and we barely saw our waiter twice the whole time. TRAIN YOUR STAFF!

I and my 5 other family members waited 45 minutes for a far below mediocre meal with a just as bad waitress. It would be an understatement to say that my family and I were belittled by the waitress. The waitress refused to come to us when we signaled. I am sure that she saw me but instead she turns away and goes to serve another table!  On top of that, the food wasn't worth the money we paid for the meal.  We will not be coming back to this ill mannered facility.

Excellent food, very attentive service.  The Manager (Lisa?) even came over to our table when she heard I accidentally spilled food on myself.  She gave me her business card and wrote on the back of it. She told me to get my shirt dry-cleaned and she would reimburse me for the bill! FYI, the Royal Red Robin burger comes with a fired egg that is over-easy, standard. In the future I'll ask for the egg to be fried 'over-hard' instead.

When we first entered we expected to be welcomed as soon as we entered, it seemed like a slow night for business.  We waited a couple of minutes until we were seated. The host was very respectful and humorous (unfortunately,  I didn't get his name).  Our waiter, Corey, was awesome. He has great customer service, memory and personality.  I told him we were celebrating 2 birthdays so, he brought two  large glasses of ice cream with fudge and wipe cream for the birthday people. He made them feel special! Food was delicious.   Large parking structure. WI-FI.  Sanitary. Shopping stores are some feet away.  There is a resting area in front of this restaurant;  where you can enjoy the view of a fountain filled with turtles, gold fish and Koi fish.

this place has the worst service. I came here with my mother, brother, and daughter.  we ordered my daughter food right away since of course as a toddler they don't have the patience as adults. (mac n cheese n apples) my mother ordered a salad and my brother a burger. I needed a minute to order because I wasn't sure.  she didn't bother asking if I needed anything else. she was always on a hurry. she kept walking away when asking for something. working in a rush. I get she may have other tables but this was ridiculous.  so on to food... Mac n cheese was great daughter loved it. red white n blue salad was drenched in dressing but other than that I'm sure it would of tasted good. blue burger was good my brother ate it all and loved it.  we ordered onion Rings the small stack and that was good it broke apart but dish was yummy.  Paula maybe had a bad day or just was Ina rush or something. but for us it was quite irritating to come in for a family dinner and have this kind of service.

I read these post and Im So confused my family and I eat at RR often We have never had bad service or bad food. We have been on slow nights and busy nights the food and service has  always been consistent but people be realistic if the restaurant is busy food might take a little longer. When you are cooking fresh food it takes time to cook be patient it's delish. The garlic fries are 2 die for. Don't listen 2 all the negative post give RR a chance you won't be disappointed

Was surprised to see this place with such a low star count. Ate here last night and my burger was delicious! The South is in the House is a must try! All the burgers looked great too! This one was a limited time only so i gave it a go. They have great beers on Draft as well. Our server Corey was nothing short of friendly and on top of his job. Didn't have to wait for refills, nor did we feel bugged during our meal with constant "checking in on you guys" conversations.

Service here is great. My server was very friendly and funny. However, the food was very meh. I ordered the crispy chicken burger. It tasted and had the same quality of something like a mcchicken from mcdonalds except it was literally 10x more expensive ($9.99+ tax). The bottom bun was soggy and falling apart. I was pretty much holding the bottom side of my burger by the meat patty. Over all the food ruined what could have been a great experience for me.

Service isn't bad. But the food is just blah.  Very standard and basic food which is overpriced. Crispy chicken sandwich is similar to McDonalds chicken sandwich except with like a tomato in it. The salad I got (which was the first one on the list of salads) I think it was the southwestern BBQ salad? Well the salad I got, didn't even taste good. I mean it was alright but all the extra stuff they put on it wasn't complementing. The grilled chicken on top of my salad was dry.  I just don't prefer the food here but our service was really great! Server was attentive.

Service was excellent. The manager came and checked on us several times. Our food tasted so, so good and was prepared according to some dietary needs. Unlimited side salad! Great! The only problem is this Red Robin is hard to find if you're not familiar with the area and it's a pain looking around the mall for it. GPS failed us. It was so worth it!

Those burgers are just bomb. All I have to say is Thanks to Lucille, my family and I had a good experiences. Lucille's customers service makes me go back, love her personality, attitude, and service. Thanks again Lucille, keep up the great work Amiga (:

Came in for a birthday dinner. Ended up having three different waiters, waited over 45 minutes for burgers (they were not very busy), received the wrong food, missing several pieces of our order, and the mint brownie shake was not made correctly. The food, when it got to us, was good as always except the shake.  Really disappointed as this place used to be a favorite of mine. Might give them one more shot before I don't come back.

This Red Robin is a family favorite of ours.  It wasn't only until a few months ago that I ever set foot in a Red Robin.  We've been here many times (usually on the weekends around lunch time) and food/service has always been consistent.  I'd have to say their customer service is pretty awesome.  We're always greeted right away, have never had to wait for a table.  Wait staff are very friendly, attentive, and check up on us often.  Wait staff always make an effort to interact with my 3 year old, which is nice.  We're usually checked up on as well by a manager.  I'm sorry to read other reviews talking about poor customer service, but all of our experiences have been the complete opposite. As far as food, we're always satisfied.  I've tried several of their burgers and have enjoyed them all.  Hubby is a fan of the prime rib dip.  And you really can't go wrong with bottomless fries.  :-)  My son always enjoys the cheesy mac 'n cheese, and in case you didn't know, that is bottomless too.  But my son is only 3, so he's always fine with just one serving. :-)   Join the loyalty program.  For every 9th entree, you get one free.  And you get a free entree on your birthday too!

This place was disgusting worst salad I've had in my life... yea I probably shouldn't be ordering a salad at a burger place but still!!! Anyway I didn't pick where to eat my friend did and she regrets it as much as I do. Our server sucked so bad... I think he was new. He forgot our napkins, straws, to-go bags.  I had to get up myself 3 different times. It wasn't even busy. I didn't even eat my food it was so bad. I brought it home in hopes someone would eat it and my money wouldn't go to waste but no one liked it either.  2 thumbs down.

Came here today to have some Lunch for my Wife's B-Day. There were about 6 tables occupied and it still took about 20 minutes to get our drinks & finally order. We sat & waited another 40 minutes (during which time the waiter never came back to our table for refills) before I asked another waiter passing by what the status was with our food. He said he would check, & walked to the back. We were close enough to hear them saying it's on it's way, but by then I was over it!  This place Sucks!! Worse service ever. We walked over to Wood Ranch BBQ and received Great service & good food.
I've been here a couple of times now and never had a big issue with the service or food..  That being said the one in brea is way better in terms of quality

I am not sure why people are hating on this RR so much.  I went here on a weekday midday and the food and service was really not bad at all.  The food is on par with other RR's I've ever been to (Glendale, San Diego) which seems pretty consistent every time.  It's a BURGER JOINT people so if you don't expect too much you won't be disappointed.  It will not be the best gourmet burger of your life but the food is good and so are the prices.  Plus, they have bottomless fries and bottomless drinks (non-alcoholic, sorry lushes). Overall I cannot speak on peak hours but when I went recently (non-peak hours) I found this RR to have pretty good food and service and I'd definitely come back.
Very slow service. Took me and my family 20 minutes just to get our drinks . By the time our food came it was cold .  Never coming here again
Terrible slow service! Bottomless fries slow to come!

Gone to plenty of red robins for over 10 years. This location has the worst service ever. I came here 3 times and deciding to give it a couple of chances but it just keeps getting worst. My wife and I order 2  burgers and asked for some fries first because we knew the kitchen was backed up. The waiter Shawn told us that fries are not an appetizer. Then  15 minutes passed by and he came to asked if we wanted some fries to start with since the kitchen is backed up. After that my wife ordered her Burger bunless and pink (assuming bunless is with a lettuce wrap. The meal came out with only a meat Patty and mushrooms, no lettuces. Also Meat was cooked rare.  Never coming to this location again.  Save your time and drive to another red Robbins. Apparently this location has bad management and horrible staff.

I love the chain and the food, my kids are loud so it works. We've eaten here about 7-8 times, and I'm compelled to leave a review. The service here is always subpar. The food always takes a long time to come out (have had a cold burger), no refills, and today we waited 10 min before someone took our drink order. Love red Robbin, but not this location.

I'm overall disappointed in Red Robin has a business. Red Robin use to be my favorite location to eat a burger, but when I came here I was not satisfied.  They started doing what is now typical of restaurants and putting the fries in a small metal ring to make it look more "presentable" but all it does is limit the amount of fries you get. I use to come when they gave you a basket of fires. The ring limits you to about 8 fries per serving.  The burgers themselves looked a lot smaller too. Before the burger would fill me up, this time I needed several fries and refills to do the job. Now has this location is concerned. It was very unorganized. We were recommended to sit at the bar by the greeter but that was a mistake. There was only one bartender serving 10 people. It was understandable that the bartender would be delayed on refilling my soda. She did try her best but everyone else I just don't know.  I will most likely never eat at a Red Robin again due to the drastic change in portion size.
Today's visit to RR must have been the cleaners day off. Tables were greasy and condiments sticky.
The hostess was rude. Seating was super slow. Food service was slow but our server Stephanie was awesome.

Well I gotta say.. I wasn't impressed, and I sorta wish I would have just gone to chili's. Granted we did get there at 9ish pm, and it was Friday night, and it wasn't crowded.  We were forgotten after putting our name in, another couple was sat WAY before us, and I had to remind the host that we were waiting. That sorta put a bad taste in my mouth, I am a HUGE stickler for service.. the food could be terrible, but is the service is great, all is made up and okay.  Anywho... after being sat, to a table that didnt have silverware or napkins, we were asked our drink order. Easy enough, gave our beer orders and were told our section's waiter would be going on break and we would meet another. Okay thats fine too. The same guys comes back, and then takes out dinner order. okay whatever, still got my order placed, why would I care.  Food is blah, not impressed. Fried soggy, and luke warm. Burger was not the best..   So up until this point, we have had drinks and food without out napkins or silverware. I ask for some, and they come right away, but jeeze.. it wasn't busy in there at all.

Never had a bad experience at red robin, but here I felt like WTF!!!   Are waiter "Sean" was ok at first got brought us drinks I got tab water to start off with. I asked for lemon wedge an never got it. I order a freckled lemonade and had to use that one to place it my water.  Second of all I get as waiter you have to be friendly to earn tips. But I am also or "was" speaking in the past tense bc I will never hopefully come back to this location of red robin. I should just gone across the mall to the "the cheese cake factory".. Getting back to subject at hand he kept talking to customer that where setting behind us when we didn't have and refreshments or fries or even a single NAPKIN and we had a child in our company. Just basic fails of satisfaction here at this location

I recently ate here, and I thought the service I had received was overall great! When we came in we instantly got out seats and started off our orders with drinks and ect. Our server was named Robert, he was energetic and very helpful. He also brought refills when we didn't even ask to get another its either he has some good eyes or he just knows when you finished, anyways the atmosphere was nice, not too loud but it wasn't as busy. The food was good as well. Definitely coming back.

RR used to be one of my favorites, but I feel like it's getting worse. It's not awful, but there are so many other burger options now that I don't think to come here much any more. The bottomless fries used to be one of the main attractions. They were really good, and I ate a lot of them. Now they don't taste that great and they are slow to bring the first smaller cup of fries or subsequent refills. Today the fries were dry and neither crispy nor soggy... I'm pretty sure they were not stale, but they just looked like it. I will note that we just discovered you can request extra crispy fries - it takes longer but it makes a huge difference. Wish we knew that before we were full. The burgers are okay. Not bad, but I expect more for the price (now creeping up to $10-$14). However, I felt like they used to taste much better. We actually had a good server today, but the service has been less than delightful the past several visits. One thing I don't like is that there tend to be a lot of noisy kids at this restaurant, and even if there are a ton of open tables, they always seat you right next to the ones who like to kick and scream.

I recently visited this Red Robin, it was a great experience.  The service was excellent. Our server, Robert was quick, polite and attentive.  The burgers and endless fries was yummy.  I  definitely will go back to this location for more excellent food and service.

Horrible service and the general manager is an asshole they changed my card for someone else's table and didn't care so I paid 100 bucks for 2 burgers and no sorry no free dessert won't come here please be aware of this place

I'm not sure how this place stays in business with its atrocious customer service!  My niece loves this place so we tried to have lunch there. We got there before 12 and it wasn't busy AT ALL.   We put our names down and waited.  People came in and did the same.  Again, the restaurant was empty, I do understand that you have to figure out where to seat everyone - I used to be a hostess - but it was just ridiculous how long they were making us wait. We finally gave up and went to another restaurant. This isn't the first time the service was bad. We had come before and again it was not busy, but the food took forever. This place has really gone down.
Always yummy and fresh. Stephanie is the most attentive, sweetest waitress and is so inviting!!

I love RR burgers and their endless basket of fries. However, their service is HORRIBLE. You wait for an hour when there are plenty of empty tables. THEN you wait even longer to get your drinks and your food. I thought it was ironic that there were so many workers but everyone seemed to be congregated in the kitchen and not doing their jobs. The one is West Covina is way better.

Good place for students or young ppl or sports lovers to hang out. Must order their signature royal red Robbin burger(comes with fries) , signature drink - strawberry lemonade. They have free refill for drinks and for fries. They have their own sauce powder for fries. Try it, it's pretty good mix sauce. Large TV screen for sports games. Just they seems like short of ppl, even they have tables, they make guests wait in line for 15 min on a Sat dinner time. Overall good burger and good strawberry lemonade! Remember to refill the drink and fries too!

We had Stephanie for our waitress. She was fantastic.  Manager Tim came by to check on us, also great to see management doing that.  Only minus a star for my teriyaki chicken burger because half of it had no sauce at all. Other than that,  everything was great

Under staffed and the cooks must have been inexperienced as the food was just okay. The onion rings stack tasted like baking soda! It was so bad I still had the aftertaste as I went to bed! So gross! It took us almost an hour just to get our hors d'oeuvres and the burgers are just okay. I don't think the food was worth the price. The juice was definitely not worth the squeeze! Our server was a nice young man that was overworked and unable to aid every table appropriately. He had a good attitude considering he was so overwhelmed. I don't recommend this location. I've been to the Red Robin in Lakewood but I didn't find it all that great either. I would just go someplace else for a good hamburger. The company was definitely better than the food.
Burgers are great but the hostesses IGNORE you, lol. Its kinda annoying but like i said the burgers are amazing. I ate here more than home last month. The manager is a GREAT guy.

I like RR but I don't know what went wrong with this one. Super slow service and wasn't even busy.  Food was too salty. Its like they got chefs that smoke so much they have no taste buds. Never again. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!!!!

I went at about 9:30pm. Wasn't full or empty. Every other table occupied. Waited around for a good 8 minutes or more. Heavier set waitress with dark hair & other server girls saw me but, i got no acknowledgement or greeting. (WT?!?) Two were busy with orders. Two saw me and turned their backs towards me to talk to their customers. The heavier set woman leaned across the booth by the front, back towards me, as if she was trying to avoid contact with me.  Finally, "Corey" came to greet me and take me to my booth. He was very polite, curtious, helpful & made some great selections from the menu to choose from. If not for him, i probably would have made a scene. I wanted to start filming everything going on i mentioned here with my cellphone camera/video recorder! (Who knows how many views this would have gotten!?) Others experiencing something like this, may have walked out after this ridiculous waiting! Anyways, my food came out in about another 8 minutes or so. Got the Bleu Cheese Burger & Fries with a Coke. Fries seemed kind less on the portion. Not sure if that was standard for Red Robin. Both were Very Delish though pricey. Meal came out to $18.84. Expensive! Corey asked if i wanted more fries, i declined. Though Corey was very nice, it seemed like a scam giving me less fries so, i can order more. Not trying to say nothing bad towards him, i have experience in "The Service Industry". More % in tips with the more food that i order! After i finished my meal, Corey kindly asked if i would like anything & i asked for the check. He was Very busy with other orders in the kitchen. I left $25 cash in the black restaurant check book and left. I thought the heavy-set waitress said goodbye but, i doubt it. She was talking to another skinny tall guy, both sitting on their knees on the front waiting area bench seats leaning on the glass partition. No eye contact, no acknowledgement. Horrible, horrible customer service!  Though the food is great, i don't mind paying a bit higher for my meal but, if not for the gentleman server Corey, i would not return here! I Was Highly Dissatisfied Tonight! Thanks Corey, you made my awful experience very pleasant! Thanks again! This place needs better servers working here. I don't know if it was a long day for them and they were relaxing towards the end of the night or what but, this really sucked! Especially, the heavy set server girl!

If you're coming here ask for a waiter named Robert! By far the best waiter I have ever come across. We were a party of 20 and he took care of us very well and went above and beyond our expectations! The food was great and the environment even better!

We had Robert as your server! AMAZING job!! He was very kind and always making sure we had what we wanted/needed! BEST service we have ever received and we were a group of 20 too! The food was really good and the bottomless fries were amazing! Great experience over all!
I absolutely love their crispy tender salad. Ashley, the bartender is also so awesome! I also like the fact that its located right outside the mall in the promenade.

My kids and husband love this Red Robin. We have only had bad service here once and at the time it was understandable since it was the holiday season. We have been to 2 other locations and the service is never like what we receive here. Fave sit down chain restaurant by far.

Love their burgers! Don't understand how this place has such a bad rating.... -.- anyway the freckled lemonade is also vry delish! I think this place is great! Once again, try the burgers. Also the chick on a stick(grilled chicken) on the kids meal tastes awesome!

This was my first time at a Red Robin i was very excited to try this place out! I ate here last week around lunch time there were a few people here and there it was not at all crowded!  I  looove burgers so I am very picky about eatting a good burger!  The waitress was nice but she kept forgetting things but over all her customer service was good! As for the food it was an okay burger i had their gourmet burger ! It was good. Their garlic fries need some tlc.  WHAT I LOVED IS THEIR $3.50 DOMESTIC BEERS. 4.00 WELLS! BUT OTHER THAN THAT ILL GIVE THIS PLACE 3 STARS BUT ILL.TRY IT AGAIN ONE MORE TIME.

You can really never go wrong by coming here, unless it's on a weekend, where you can anticipate a wait. But they're food is always good. I usually come here for a turkey burger and bottomless fries, and if I'm really hungry I order the onion rings stack.

Like many people in other reviews, I enjoyed the food. It was the slow service from start to finish, that made this experience dissatisfying. Waiting 30 minutes to be seated with only two names ahead of me, to waiting nearly 30 minutes for our food to be served from the time we ordered. Over and over our table's conversation went to, "where is our food, they are just cooking burgers!". Thinking this was a kid friendly place they would know of the short attention span of a child and having them wait so long means by the time food arrives they was to get out and run around. I saw other families struggle with their young kids as they became restless like mine. Burgers looked ok, tasted good but patties were thin like I went to some fast food place instead of a restaurant. So probably will not return, just can't go out to a place that moves at a snails pace when kids are part of my company.

Was craving for some gourmet burgers so we came here last friday night. Of course being friday night it was busy but NOT too busy to where you neglect customers like crazy.  We were told the wait would be 30 minutes and then 30 minutes turned into a 1 hour wait. Now I'm usually an impatient person but I controlled my self that night. We finally got our name called and proceeded to our table. We waited 10 minutes until a waitress acknowledged us and said she'll be with us in a minute. Well that minute turned into 20 minutes and everyone around us were getting food and drinks. So I got piss and we just got up and left. We pretty much wasted an hour and 30 minutes due to their horrible customer service. But a part of me did wanted to stay and have the satisfaction of not tipping the waitress, oh well next time..because with their service there will be a next time.
Writing this review as I wait for my food...been siting here for over 30 min...this place is empty...servers are working in slow motion with no sense of urgency...first and last time I come here

Service is extremely slow and the table next to us has not been cleared since we sat down.  We waited a long time to be seated then had to ask the busboy (who passed the table next to us) to get our waiter.  Then the waiter dropped off a tray of utensils and napkins for us to pass out ourselves.  If we didn't like the food, we would be out of here.  Though this is the closest Red Robin for us, I can guarantee his will be the first/last time we eat here. Terrible.

Hey everyone stop into a Red Robin my experience was a great one, I was very satisfied with the buffers where great, staff where friendly happy they all helped each other, I recommend you give theRed Robin a try . Kevin Montoya. Ps fantastic I rings there the best !!!

My last experience with Red Robin in Arcadia was less than positive.  The manager invited us back and this time we had a the best service and wonderful food that we are used to from Red Robin.  Thank goodness my bad experience was an isolated one.   Paula was the greatest and my compliments to the chef We will be back soon!!!

Love coming here always a great place to eat friendly service. Great beer shakes had the blue moon shake, can't wait to try the Irish shake they have. You have to try the love burger with a turkey burger instead of the beef you will not be disappointed.

I called in my order to take advantage of the pick up service that's being offered by red Robin. I called at 6:15 and arrived at the restaurant at 7 o'clock. Upon my arrival no one knew where my order was. Upon speaking to the manager there John Massaro, he stopped and took time to make sure that I was taken care of. He gave me a soda and had my order in my hand within 7-10 minutes. He apologized several times and made me feel like a priority. He knows what customer service is all about! Thank you John!!! I will be back!!
Service is extremely slow!! But Randy the manager is really nice! He is the only reason we didn't walk out!

First time I was here a few months ago there was barely any people dining here. The service was very horrible and there was no acknowledgment. I decided to give it another chance... Today it's worse. The service was horrible and the server kept making excuses. Took a long time to be noticed every time we asked for service. The waitress told us that she would be right back to take our order and we waited 10 mins. The food took way too long. I won't come back to this location. Probably try to find another one to go to...

Called my order in for a bowl of chili, sweet potato fries, side of sour cream and ketchup. 30 minutes later I got a half bowl of chili for $5.79 one teaspoon of sour cream for .79 cents, no utensils, no ketchup. The girl that placed her order after me got her food at the same time. The restaurant was not busy when I arrived and only started getting busy just before I received my food.

I don't always review chains since they are supposed to be uniform in their expectations of quality and service, however I make exceptions for the ones you should be warned about or the ones that really demand recognition for excellence.  We came in as a party of 4 for a birthday and it seemed like the majority of customers had the same idea, as we heard celebratory songs the whole night. Despite that, the restaurant seemed pretty slow and not crowded at all at 7:30pm. There was a server change, which made things all the more confusing and there was no smooth transition or effective communication between the servers, as our server did not deliver the bottomless fries before our burgers and we were starving while the burgers took forever to come out.  The food itself was good, but it was difficult to really get any substantial service. We had to ask the server a couple of times for fairly simple things-- box, check, etc. When the bill came, the birthday burger was not marked off and I had to flag down the server again to make sure it was taken off and the Loyalty number had to be taken again (remember the former server had left early on).  All in all, it was quite a frustrating experience. I am not sure if it was our particular waitress that wasn't efficient, the kitchen staff, management of the place overall, or a combination of all of the above but I could tell straight off the bat that the servers had to traverse longer distances because of unclean tables and spreading the diners out when there are apparently not enough staff. I really have no idea what was going on that night. It was just unpleasant.  Our server did however bring all the things we requested despite asking her several times, so that was good. She also got some plates for us to cut our birthday cake; unfortunately we didn't have a birthday song, but I suppose our guest of honor didn't want to partake in such a tradition, so it was good for her.  This meal took 1.5 hours overall -- that's how slow it was. It was actually reaching up to 2 hours after the bill was paid. Any plans of shopping around after dinner were thrown out the window after this. Oh well.  Lesson learned-- go to other Red Robin locations, just not this one. Unless you're here for cheap drinks, because that's a different story.

This chain location of red robin is at Westfield Santa Anita, at the outdoor shopping area.  Came here with the folks. Waited about 10 minutes to be seated. Got seated and then ordered. I had the A1 peppercorn burger. I had a birthday special so I got my burger free but I don't know. This location was below my experiences compared to other red robins. The burger was flat, almost no flavor except salt. It was poorly put together and just.... Meh. Maybe it's something management should look into if they cared. The endless  fries saved the meal. Took a while to get sauces for them though. The server I had was.... Disinterested in her work but she was competent. Everyone there seemed like they hated their job which didn't exactly create a pleasant eating experience. Yea yea it's a burger joint and not a three star Michelin restaurant... But still. This will probably be my last time at this location.
Yay we live this spot. .Raul in the bar is a sweetheart and the burgers are decent. . Parking is great and $3.50 bud light and Coors light all day. ..

Brought my sister and her boyfriend here for their first time! We came right after the Memorial Carnival at the Santa Anita race track on Friday. The mall wasn't that busy, so it was a good time to drop by without long lines. So, they were craving In 'N Out and I suggested Red Robins instead. Little did they know, the burgers here are bomb AF, plus bottomless fries! WHUT?! We all ordered the most affordable burger on the menu, of course the Red Taverns Double! for $6.99, you get a gourmet burger with bottomless seasoned fries! I think that's better than an In 'N Out double double animal style cheeseburger!  Anyways, I ordered an Arnold Palmer (ice tea lemonade) here for the first time, I assumed it would be sort of sweet.. since other places I ordered from were slightly sweet instead of bland. Meh, I guess they added more ice tea than the lemonade. Whatev's, NBD! (: Continuing.. we got our food, and we smashed our face with the burgers! We were SOO hungry, we all devoured everything within 10 minutes! What?! We then asked for another round of fries and devoured that within minutes too! They LOVED the fries and the taste of the delicious burger! Not to mention... today, my sister and her boyfriend asked me to take them back to Red Robins so they can eat what we ate last time! haha I knew they would fall in love with this place! I'm glad that I got my Royalty card too! I need a few more orders to get myself the free 10th item! Can't wait for my free birthday meal too! Also, if I knew that coming to Red Robins 5 times for the first 5 weeks after activating my card, I would be getting a free purchase of a burger, an entree, or a full-sized salad or sandwich! What the heck man?! If only I knew this!! I go to Red Robins often too! GAH! In addition to misinforming us about what we NEED to know about the Royalty card, out of all the RR's i've been to, and I come to this one often especially, only ONE employee informed me about not having your card with you and you can still use your phone number to enter your points in for purchasing there. Everywhere and everyone else tells me that I have to have the card physically in order to get my reward points? What the hell?! I could've gotten 4 free burgers by now! DAMN YOUUUU!  Nonetheless, just come for the gourmet burgers and delicious appetizers and drinks! Don't forget to get a royalty card for some perks! (:
They took their time to bring me a burger and fries, maybe 30 mins and they were understaffed so I couldn't get water for the first 10 mins

The restaurant seated 40 of us when we cakes last minute.  They did a great job of getting us all together.  The gm is very nice and helped where he could  Took a while to order and get drinks but that is expected with such a large group.  The waitress did a great job of getting refills and sauces quickly and made is feel really welcome.  The fries are not my favorite,  I don't like steak fries,  but the seafood scatter was great,  juicy crispy fried clans and shrimp.  The fish was really moist as well.  The bathroom was nice and clean too. The only off thing is the tables slide around a lot  I am glad to have gone.

It was dead and the service was still pretty bad, I'm almost impressed. Communication seems to be a real issue here. We ordered root beer floats and the ice cream comes from the bar, the sodas came first then we had to wait for the ice cream which took a few mins which wouldn't be an issue except that when the bartender finally got around to pouring the ice cream and my milkshake he just walked off... The waitress noticed a while after and then ran to get the ice cream and shake. Also ordered French Onion soup ended up with Tortilla soup.  Not a great experience at this location and I'm told that is normal for this location.

What happened? I never had problems here before. The kids meal with the All you can eat Mac N Cheese is now only one small bowl. It's only pasta and cheese! Then, unfortunately I got food poisoning an hour and a half later. I ordered the Garden Veggie patty. It must have been old or under cooked. I haven't felt that bad in years! I felt much better after I threw it all up.  Horrible. I can't come back after that!
Was there for lunch with friends today , service was bad.  We can not find the waitress and she never came to check on us.  Our water and drink never got refill.  I would never to back there.
Glo and her guys made us feel good last Saturday...food excellent, service very good...she is very friendly and genuine...I always like the bar area better...thanks!
This is a great place for burgers and the ambiance is fabulous!  It's great for people on low carb diets like me. Or for gluten sensitive people!

My experience was the same as my first: same super slow service, expensive prices, poor-to-average food portions, and average tasting food. I especially did not like that the greeter at the front ignored us because she was on the phone, she could have at least acknowledge us and tell us she'll be with us in a minute (she was on the phone for a while). I ordered the Nacho Crunch Tavern Burger and it was barely crunchy or cheesy, not nacho-tasting at all. I thought I received the wrong burger when it was first delivered and had to ask a waiter.  I have no idea why the service and food comes out so slow, given that there seems to be many employees. I would only come back for the free birthday burger you get from signing up for the email newsletter program.

Poor customer service at this RR. It took about 10 minutes + for our server to greet our table. It was not particularly busy that afternoon, so we didn't know what his reason was for being so slow. I most likely won't be returning again.  The food was pretty good though. That's the only reason why the restaurant received 3 stars.

2.5 Stars I don't think I've stepped foot inside a Red Robin since 2008.... I came here with 6 coworkers to celebrate a couple birthdays.  At 11:45AM, the restaurant was not busy at all and we were seated within a few minutes.  We ordered onion rings to share and they dropped some on the floor. They told us they would make more to make up for it. (I actually don't remember if they did or not.) We ordered burgers and salads for the most part and everyone had mixed reviews. My friend who sat next to me said she didn't like her salad. The crispy chicken in it was very dry and the birthday girl also did not enjoy her mushroom burger. She said it was different from the last time she ordered it. My other coworker ordered her usual turkey burger on wheat but with steak fries. I was aiming for a salad as well, but ultimately got the Original Red Robin Cheeseburger with steak fries and a peach iced tea. I thought the burger tasted fine and it came with endless fries, but one portion was enough for me.  The manager visited our table and asked us how everything was. Our coworker also got a small sundae and some of the staff sang to her. Overall, it was just an average experience with average food. Our server was just okay. She spoke with very monotone voice and barely smiled, but she did her job. 126/100 Reviews for 2015

Went here during the weekday because Soup Plantation some 5 minutes away was packed (couldn't find parking).  As soon as we are seated here at Red Robin, my date asks if the Raspberry ice tea is sweetened. When the waitress says that the regular ice tea is the only one not sweetened, I decide to take it. Though my date says she will decide on a drink once it is time to order the meal, the waitress still brings both of us an iced tea.  Now the waiting part of this visit.....for it being very slow and very empty, our waitress is walking right by us several times, even though we are clearly ready to order. She then heads off to a table near the entrance and along with the manager, is dealing with what looks like a customer disputing their order (this wasn't even her section). I then see her go to the kitchen, trash-talking that customer to another co-worker (you don't ever want to be served by someone like this.....how do you know she won't trash you behind your back the same way?). She then walks right by us to help a couple sitting in an outdoor table (since the outdoor area was directly behind me, not sure if that couple was here before me). By this time, I am now telling my date to prepare to leave should we still have to wait another minute or two (the guy busing the tables behind me heard me but did nothing to help). When I see our waitress pass us again only to walk behind the counter near the kitchen and share a few laughs with another waiter, I tell my date that we are leaving. From the time this waitress brought us our drinks to the time I walked out, she must have walked right by our table some 4-5 times in a span of 10-15 minutes (trust me....other than the couple sitting outside and a group of 4 who already paid their check and left, there was no one else in her section).  A lesson to be learned.....I don't care how great the food looks on an online photo or how attractive the place is or what kind of fantastic discounts you see online, American-chained restaurants (most but not all) are not about customer service or quality but about bad service, rising prices, and shrinking portions. Most employees like this waitress are nothing more than part-time workers who wouldn't care less about bad feedback or service simply because this is not going to be their career. Mom and Pop owned restaurants/eateries are the way to go because to them, it is always about "the customer". Another lesson to be learned....for someone who always reads Yelp Reviews, I still don't understand why I did not read the reviews of this place (mostly 1-2 star reviews) before showing up.  ALWAYS READ YELP REVIEWS BEFORE CONSIDERING A VISIT TO A RESTAURANT YOU ARE TRYING FOR THE FIRST TIME OR FOR THE FIRST TIME IN YEARS.

Highly disappointed on my trip to this establishment. I was raving about this place to my husband , as I had been there years ago, after we went to see a movie and he felt like a burger. He wanted to go to Wendy's but after a bad incident the last time o thought this place would be better only to regret it. First off our waitress was nice, but kept having our orders wrong. And non it wasn't that busy but then again it could be her first time, this wasn't really the issue though. The problem was our burgers weren't really good, Wendy's would've been better and for half the price. I ordered mine with "no pink" (well done) as so did my husband, but mine still had a lot of pink, I'm guessing it was medium rare. Thought of saying something but I didn't want spit on my food, so i sucked it in and hoped it was at least as good as it looked. But no. The onions were battered, with mostly grease of you ask me. The fries were okay, but you get a very small.portion , I'm guessing so they don't waste a lot since they are 'bottomless' . The campfire ranch dressing was ok. Atmosphere was so so. All in all its not the place I remember it to be, and the quality of the food and taste have changed for the worst. Never again.

My family has eaten here a few different times, maybe 2 or 3 times because we enjoy the Santa Anita Mall and it's located there. The food here is pretty good. Sometimes the fries are cold though. The service though... The service is the reason for my 3 stars. We ate there this past Thursday for my birthday and hoping the service would be different from our previous visit but sad to report it wasn't. We only get drink refills once and checked on once. In my opinion, if your dining in for over an hour, you should be "checked on" at least 4 times, minimum, we have a baby with us, we always need more napkins and water refills.  Service is important in the food industry and the more my husband and I dine out the more we see how much the industry has changed (since we worked in it). Zero sense of urgency, mediocre attitudes, less and less smiling. In my opinion if food servers continue down this route, families are going to continue to turn to more convenient means of food service. And please I know all the ups and downs and challenges of working in the hospitality/food industry, been there done that. People WILL tip better when your service is genuine, fast, and friendly.

2 stars for food.  I used to love  this place, especially their bottonless fries since I love fries.  But for the past few times when I visit this place,  foods all came out slow and not eben hot.  I understand its all you can eat fries but why can they just give me enough fries at first?  fries that cones with my burger looks like leftovers and so little.  What happen to that nice looking basket thats full of yummy fires that they used to hand out?  Sad..Sad....Ssd..Oh well Give another star for the waiter.  He is nice and making jokes but we have to keep asking for refills...

Pretty much known for their bottomless fries and lemonade. Honestly the service was super slow... It took them 30 mins to get out my FIRST refill on fries. But i guess i cant complain because the fries were fresh out of the oven. It was hot and crispy. Our waiter was nice and the food was decent. Go if you want to just eat the burgers, but dont expect a TON of fries...

I came in on Labor Day with a party of 5. Our server Denise was genuinely nice and checked on us consistently to give us drink refills and more fries. It was pretty busy but she still managed to serve us well.

Server Denise made our experience terrible. So much for celebrating birthdays here. Not only do you need to work to get their reward program, but they make you argue and fight to get rewards that you've earned. Not only that, but Denise had a poor tone of voice, and sounded frustrated that we wanted to split the check. Your time and your money is better spent elsewhere.

Their management read my review and contacted me for additional feedback and confirmation. They invited me back to give them another try or so. Since my last review, I went back maybe 1-2 times. While the food is on par with your normal chain restaurant food in terms of consistency and variety to cater to a wide demographic and hasn't changed in the times I've returned (and food wasn't the problem), it's the service that varies. I encountered the most outstanding server on my most recent visit on Labor Day 2015. It wasn't too busy on a 7 pm dinner, but I can tell they probably just had their dinner rush as a lot of empty tables were not bussed yet. We were seated in the wayyyy back, at the last booth before the doors to the outside deck. I was sure we may be overlooked at our spot, but our server Leo made sure we were attended to. After he took our order, he came back multiple times to see if we needed drinks refilled, another batch of bottomless fries, or anything else. I was really impressed. His attention was almost a complete 360 from the service we received at all prior visits to Red Robin!! I sure hope to be seated in his section the next time I return to Red Robin. His service and demeanor (friendly, did not show any signs that it might have been a long day or shift, especially working on a holiday) really stood out and made the meal a pleasant experience.

Came here for lunch. Hostess was nice and sat us quickly. Plenty of parking. Waiter was very friendly. He even brought our bottomless fries to munch on before we got our burgers.  California chicken burger was good. Thick piece of chicken breast with guac, lettuce, and tomatoes. Chicken wasn't too dry.  A1 Peppercorn burger was very very peppercorn-y. So if you don't like the strong taste of peppercorn, stay away! Beef patty was cooked perfectly pink to our request.  Both burgers were served with more fries. The steak fries were ok. A little on the soggier side but I like my fries like that. Not too much flavor but you can add the Red Robin signature blend seasoning to them if you like (bottle is at each table). They were much better with the seasoning! We also tried the garlic herbed fries (extra 99 cents) which weren't anything special. They just sprinkled with chopped cilantro and Parmesan cheese on their usual steak fries.  The Royal Red Robin is probably the best burger on the menu. It's basically a cheeseburger with a fried egg. It's definitely my favorite burger they offer.  With the huge burgers and bottomless fries, your palate won't get overly excited but you'll definitely leave full. Can't expect too much from a chain restaurant but it's still better than most of the other ones out there.
I came here for an early lunch and had the slowest service. Our waitress didn't introduce herself and didn't even bring our drinks. Horrible customer service skills.

Food is consistent (that's one star) although portions do not reflect their prices. I guess they figure the royalty rewards card will bing people back. It's certainly not for the "friendly" hosts at the front door or the inconsistent service. Today was good (another star) - some days meh - other days just down right "I am leaving NOW!"

Better experience at the bar. Coors Light, 22oz - $4.50 - Came in a big chilled glass! Shroom Burger w/ Grilled Onions - $10.49 + .55 - Packed with sauteed mushrooms. Needed some lettuce for crunch and sauce for the bun. Great burger if you like mushrooms. Wedgie Burger w/ Mushrooms - $10.49 + $1.39 - I replaced the patty with grilled chicken. Very good lettuce wrapped sandwich. Love the bacon and guac combo. Mushrooms were a great add for me. Comes with a side salad. Side Fries - $1.99 Side Salad - $1.99 - Decent size for 2 bucks.  Would have bumped them to a 3 star but food took forever and fries were cold again and no one was even in the restaurant!

Recently started going back to this location since we rediscovered the Red Robin in a different location (Northridge) and loved it. Did not love this one. Big crowd out front and we were told there was a 20 minute wait. Then I was told the bar was open and could sit right away, after the hostess turned away from me to point to the area and talk and I had to ask her twice to please face me when she talks, her voice was simply soft.  We go to the bar and on the way I saw nothing but empty tables. Crowds waiting out front, but plenty of empty tables. Made zero sense and swamped the bar tender (super nice guy). We order and wait, play a trivia game and wait. The food arrives and its luke warm at best. As far as bottomless fries, I got six. Six fries. Six individual fries. I ordered the black and blue burger - ordered it medium rare. It was over cooked. After a few bites I also noticed it was spicy. I've ordered the exact same burger at two other locations and it was wonderful. I was really hungry and thought I was just being a wimp about spice but it was pretty bad. My girlfriend ordered a ghost pepper burger and hers was not spicy, so we figured out they got something wrong. I wait and wait and wait to talk to someone, even hit the 'call server' button on the little kiosk and two servers (not the bar tender) walked right past us. Then I see the group behind me had the little light flashing as well and it was going unnoticed. Finally I ask for a menu again to look for any spice on the burger just to make sure it wasn't my mistake. It wasn't. I sat so long I gave up and paid. By the time anyone really came to listen to me (the poor swamped bartender) I had given up. And I have given up again. I will stick to the Northridge or Glendale location. It's out of my way but the food and service much better.

Excellent service and food! The food here is delicious and the rockabilly/ retro/ pop decor is well suited for families with kids that need something interesting to look at but is great for anyone since all of the posters are so interesting!  I've tried most of their food and it's all delicious. Bottomless fries are the best. While we were there the GM or possibly a boss form corporate checked on us and offered us a free dessert, how nice of him!

My wife and I decided to Red Robin for lunch,thus is my wife first time at Red Robin.  I haven't been to a Red Robin almost for 20 years that's a long time,I know you are thinking why it took me a long time to come back to Red Robin. This Red Robin in Westfield Santa Anita mall nice location.   We step in the restaurant it was packed but we found seating and the waiter came right away to our table and hand us the menu and we order our drinks.   When waiter came back with our drinks we decided  to our meal,we order two appetizer  mini tower of onion rings and beer and cheese with mini pretzel.  My wife order the Red Robin classic a cheeseburger  and comes with bottomless fries and I order the grilled turkey burger. Couple minutes later the waiter brought us our appetizers I took a bite of onion rings  they were good I like the dripping  sauce comes with the onion rings.  My wife  and I  like beer and cheese pretzel it was good and beer and cheese sauce was so good.  And finally our meal my wife Red Robin cheeseburger  classic looks delicious.  My Grilled turkey was OK good I thought  needed more flavors in Turkey burger and the burger fixing.

Service by the bar is great and attentive.  Ordered the new crispy chicken salad: chicken is good, salad was eh. Freckled lemonade: lacked flavor big time. Fries: these are probably the worst fries I've had in a while. Needs salt and flavor in general. Food was pretty blah.
