I tried the double patty burger with fries of course. Very tasty but kind of small or maybe I was just really hungry. I was sitting at the bar area and met some really good people that day. Very interesting conversations, the bartender Paula I believe her name is has great customer service and a lot of knowledge regarding the menu and the drinks she's serving behind the bar. Thank you for everything and especially the endless fries!!

Service was bad. It was going good at first which surprised me because of all the other reviews I read, but after we ordered, I know exactly what the other Yelpers are talking about. Our food took a while to come out which didn't seem like a big deal since I understand food actually DOES take time to cook. However,  when asking for refills, sauce, and more fries, they took FOREVER. Half the time, our waiter was nowhere to be seen or we saw him standing by the kitchen talking to his coworker.  The food is nothing to rave or complain about. It's not that special in my opinion. The fries aren't all that great either.

This location is in the promenade of the Santa Anita Mall, so be prepared to look for some parking if you go during the weekend. $10 for a burger and unlimited fries. You really can't beat that. The burgers are very juicy and tastes great, but what makes it better are those unlimited fries. It's awesome because they're unlimited, but I hate it because they're unlimited. LOL! I end up leaving with a food baby in my tummy that consists of a million fries.

I give five stars cause I love the burgers here! It's the fact you can customize your burgers and I love the Onion herb bun! Plus you have a choice of fries to boot. And not sure for how long but they have fried cheese curds. This location has it on the outside of the mall but you still need to pro at the mall. But parking is easy and if use the garage it's located top of the escalator.

Horrible service they served our food so hot my boyfriend got a really bad burn from trying to eat it a few minutes after it was served ( GOOD restaurants serve it at the perfect temp for customers) and to top it off the waitress accused us of not paying for a drink we ordered at the bar even tho we had just paid her like 10 minutes before ugh so embarrassing will never come back here again or recommend it to Anyone

I ate here on Mon Nov 30, 2015 for the second time.  I claimed my FREE birthday burger, which included thick, bottomless fries.  I ordered the banzai burger and it was very yummy!  The beef patty was thick, juicy and well-seasoned.  The cook even stopped by my table to ensure that my order was correct.  I wanted an extra toasted bun, easy mayonnaise and my meat cooked medium-well.  Everything was done right! Brittany, the hostess was friendly and let me pick any booth or seat that I wanted when I entered the doors.  My server, Lisa, was also very nice, friendly & attentive.  She stopped by my table frequently to ask how the food tasted and if I needed extra hot water or more fries. This is a great place to hang out with a friend or eat alone, if you want great food + service! :D

I know it's near Christmas time and this dump is at the mall........but it wasn't that busy in there and the hostess sat us in the "bar" area where we thought would be ok because we would order a beer or two.....WOW....5 minutes later a person came by with settings and said I'll be back in a minute......5 minutes after that she came back and said something about being the only one in that area and she's the bartender and blah blah blah.....so we ordered our complete order and waited another 20 minutes and gave up and left.....as we left the same bubble headed hostess told us to have a nice night!!......classic morons at this place.....RUN AWAY LIKE WE DID!!!!
I ordered the Gourmet Cheeseburger, Onion Rings, and a Poppin' Purple Lemonade. And It was good, the Poppin' Purple Lemonade was something different.
A few waitresses were complaining and talking rudely about customers. Food isn't great. Our waitress was helpful. But would not recommend coming here if you're expecting great customer service.

Great spot to take a break, grab a bite to eat and even a drink during a long shopping trip. I usually stop by here with the fiance for a drink or two toward the ending of our shopping day.  The bar is small, but the bartenders are friendly. Red Robin is located at the Santa Anita mall on the West side. If you park in the new parking structure and take the escalator all the way up to the top, you can't miss it.

Wanted a kid friendly restaurant with adult menu. My kids had the Mac n Chez w broccoli. I have a 4 & 7yo. It wasn't enough for them. I ordered a turkey burger with sweet potatoes. It was 1pm. The manager said they ran out. I got bottomless fries. Yum. SP fries are healthier. I think more people are making healthier choice. Red robins going to have to keep up.  The restroom (very clean) had a kid size sink. My 4yo loved that.  Brian our server was great. He took back food and served quickly. Thank you Brian. We had a lot of kids at the table and he was great. Thank you.

Came here on a Friday night at around 4 pm. Service is TERRIBLE! I have been here a few times before but this time, I sat at the bar and had the WORST bartender/server. This woman has blonde hair with black roots and wears eyeglass. My sister ordered a drink and I requested water with no ice as I stated I am sick, but she gives me it with ice. No big deal as I had to ask another worker to do her job. But what made it worse was to wait 15+ mins for what they call, bottomless fries. Mind you, this place wasn't busy. Probably had 25 people here with 10+ workers. I could see the fries from the bar sitting there getting cold. Soooooo bad.

The workers at this red robin make their company look bad. Which is shameful because this is the first red robin I've been to with such terrible experiences countless times.  Sluggish service and servers who need to pick up on their people skills.  One too many times I've been wrongly charged for my meal here. If this location could grab a rate of negative stars I would choose that.

This was my first time at a red robin and i was everything short of disappointed.  My waitress lisa was amazing! So sweet and so nice to my kids. She broke down the whole menu and i felt confident of the meal i chose. We all were, my wife, kids, brother in law, and father in law. It was obviously busy but we consistently got our fry and salad refills. Our entrees were hot and tasted great. Staff 10. Lisa a 10 for sure. We will be back. Thank you red robin
The service is so good. The waiters are very patient and the food is very filling and satisfying
First time at this location and Sean was our server. Attentive and friendly! He made dinner seamless...refills, more fries, brought extra napkins and all without asking!!! Thank you Sean!!

I had this random craving for endless fries and my friend mentioned that they have a "Two Tavern Burgers plus Appetizer or Dessert for only $15" deal right now, so I brought my family here for my dad's birthday. This place wouldn't be ideal on a weekend as it's located in the Santa Anita Mall, so parking can be difficult. On the other hand, we came on a Thursday night and it was practically empty. Upon arrival, it took them awhile for a host to come seat us. Once seated, our server was very accommodating. We had two sets of the deal, which the server indicated will result in a two separate checks, but no problem. For the appetizers, the four of us shared the O'Rings Shorty ($5) and Salsa, Guac, and Chips ($5). Both appetizers were very greasy, but it's typical American food. I liked the crunch of the onion rings and the salted chips with both their respective complimentary sauces. As for the burgers, I had the Fiery Ghost, brother had the Nacho Crunch, mother had the Pig Out, and father had the Tavern. Two of us paired it with fries while the other two paired with steamed broccoli --either way, both are endless, which is awesome. When we got our burgers, I thought I remembered them being a lot bigger. At most, the burgers were average and seemed to lack much ingredients. Make sure you season your fries and broccoli as the seasoning is bomb. When it was time for pay, you can pay by card on your own with their little tablet on each table. I noticed that our deals came out to $17 instead of $15, so I had to call our server over to fix the problem. My brother and mine burger were switched as well and we didn't even realize it until I was a few bites in. Their service is a bit of a mess, but when mentioned, they were gladly able to fix it. Either way, I think I'd rather spend a little more for an amazing burger than one that I could make myself.

My boyfriend and I are frequent Red Robin visitors, and to be fair we've always had good service here.  However tonight we came in, were seated promptly, waited 20 minutes, then got up and walked out. No one ever came to wait on us, no staff even acknowledged our presence, and there were maybe about 15 people in the restaurant, not really busy. Very rude.
Their pig out tavern double is one of my favorite burgers to eat. Customer service is also great.

This red robin has the worst service out of any I have ever been to. It is consistently awful. I worked at red robin for four years and It's just so obvious that even the management at this location has given up.

Literally the worse service I have ever experienced at Red Robin or any place for that matter.  More than once I have walked with my family to get seated and there no one there to greet or seat us.  We wait anywhere from 5-10 minutes and not a single person comes up.  To top it all off, they weren't even that busy...this place gives red robin a very very very bad name
Ordered the turkey burger...omg...it never disappoints! Our server Denise was excellent! She was friendly and patient (I take forever to order) ... We will be back soon!

DO NOT GO HERE. THEY HAVE NO CLUE ON HOW TO OPERATE A RESTAURANT.  A 40 minute wait for food after ordering. They get 1 star because the food was not wretched. The BS excuse was that, on a Saturday night they were short staffed. Really? Then either management has no clue on how to staff a restaurant or cannot get people to work a profitable shift. Either way management needs to change career.

Service in Arcadia is Terrible! I have given this location a few chances but have yet to experience decent service. I continue to go because I love Red Robin, but will travel out of my way to San Dimas which always gives the best service.  The waiter Sean did not come up to us right away, instead decided to continue to talk to coworkers near the kitchen. When he finally came over about 15 minutes later (the place was fairly empty) he said "did I give you enough time to decide what you wanted." At first, not a big deal even better that we didn't have to wait to give our food order.  The food took an unusually long time to come out. Sean was MIA while we waited. When he picked up the food from the kitchen my friend had noticed it had been sitting there awhile. He was nice enough when he dropped it off asked if we needed anything then disappeared. He Never came back to check on us to ask if we wanted more of those bottomless fries. My friend had to wave down one of the other waiters to get a box for her leftovers. As I was paying the bill on there computer Sean appeared to ask if we needed anything else. At that point we were very disappointed and wanted to leave. We wont be going back to the Arcadia Location. After reading other reviews mine is not the first to complain about service. Hopefully they can get it together.

We come to this location for lunch very often, it's a friendly atmosphere right from the welcome walking in the door.  We always sit in a booth in the bar area, we have a couple of ladies there that are our favorite servers, they are always so awesome and take great care of us.  We've been using the table top kiosk to pay our bill at the end of our visit for a few months now, it's ok.  Now it appears they are encouraging use of the kiosk to also submit orders, at least for appetizers.  Well, even though I strongly prefer that personal interaction with a server I went ahead and gave it a try to order a Chili Con Queso appetizer, our favorite.  I have to say the ordering experience using the table top kiosk was anything but user friendly.  Instead of scrolling through a list of available appetizers, I had to start out by picking the pricing range?  What's up with that?  I didn't recall what it costs, so I had to hunt and peck until I found it.  It would have taken a fraction of the time just to tell our server what we wanted.  I call the table top experiment a "Fail", don't take away the great personal interaction and friendly atmosphere that comes with exchange with a real person, not a machine.  Otherwise, we like this location a lot, and the food is always great.  If the atmosphere becomes cold and automated, it won't be somewhere we'd personally look forward to visiting much.  Just my 2 cents.  :-)

Outstanding! Every time we come to RedRobbin, they never miss a beat. From the seating hostes to our waiter and Chef in the kitchen.  I am never disappointed. I make sure when I come to make it clear that I require the best, in subtle ways, ofcourse... The hostes told me the wait would be 15 to 20 minutes. I looked around and noticed that everyone wanted to eat RedRobbin today. I replyied to the hosted, "ok, that means it will be about 30 mins." She appear a bit uncomfortable, but with an expression that indicated she agreed to my estimate. To my surprise we got called in 9 mins! When we got our seats, the Manager on shift came by and introduced himself with a greeting. Our server, Paula, was very cordile, attentive and fast with the food. Chef / Bar were on point with the Red Spanish Sangria and the Brushetta Chicken Sandwich was Awesome. Kids had the Chicken Warp and Bottomless Fries.

Guilt trip wanted? Red Robin in the Westfield mall is the place to be!  Having been familiar with other Red Robins it was a no brainer when we were trying to decide where to have dinner, yet our experience was quite disappointing for a number of reasons. Immediately after being seated our server, Sean, arrived to take drink orders. He wasn't polite and seemed like he was trying too hard to be sarcastic, but it just came across as rude. He made a comment (maybe was trying to joke) when we asked for separate checks in the beginning of meal-and we were trying to be accommodating and helpful. Our food came and he neglected to bring a few of the sauces that we asked for, we had to ask multiple times for our beloved campfire sauce. When we were done with the meal and were using the device to split the payment he did ask if we had Royalty cards, but he was snarky when we tried to use it and it didn't go through. He was quick to jump and say it probably wasn't registered (despite the fact that we have in fact used it multiple times). Finally he took away the device and came back with two remaining checks for those who hadn't yet paid.  The food was good, the atmosphere is always good, the service needs work.

Bottomless steak fries?? YES PLEASE! I usually rotate between the teriyaki burger (it comes with a grilled pineapple!), the mushroom burger, and the guacamole bacon burger. So good! While it's certainly pricier than say, Jim's or In-n-Out, the portion is actually quite large. I always end up taking half my burger home. Plus, it comes with BOTTOMLESS FRIES (What? I said that already?). You definitely get a better deal here than at other gourmet burger places (*cough cough I'm looking at you Umami). You can substitute the unlimited fries with other options such as unlimited sweet potato fries or garlic fries for ~$1. ALWAYS opt for garlic fries. They're worth it. Trust. My experience with the waitstaff at this location is generally on the positive side. While they could be a little slow when you ask for more fries/refills on bottomless drinks they are always friendly and courteous. I've noticed that if you sit closer to the kitchen they are much faster with whatever you ask for. PRO TIP: Sign up for their royalty program to get a free burger every year during the month of your birthday (upgrading your fries is also free when you use this offer!). If you go to Red Robin frequently, every 9 burgers/entrees/salads you buy, you get the 10th free (NOT limited to 1 per visit! If you and 3 friends all go and get burgers and only you have a rewards card, all 4 of those purchases count towards your 10th free burger! WHOOPEE). 3.5 stars.
Food arrived cold. Sangria was watered down no flavor no fruit. The wait time for food was super long and the restaurant wasn't full.

Good burgers, but SERVICE..IS..HORRIBLE. The host sucks at her job. I've been here a couple of times and she never wants to seat us!! She tells us to go sit at the bar. So I always walk to the bar and sit down. Takes foreverrrrr to get a menu. Takes foreverrrr for the server to take our order. Takes foreverrrr to get water and napkins. But the food is good. :)

Rarely do I give out 1-star reviews but this place was probably the worst restaurant experiences I've had.  Let's see where to start... Walked in on a Friday night around 9:00 p.m. because this was one of the very few places open late here at the mall (Santa Anita Westfield Mall). It was pretty empty for a Friday night so I thought we would get seated pretty quickly. Nope. The Host, some guy with glasses with a red tie, slowly emerged from the kitchen (of all places) and every so slowly walked toward us to help us. Not much enthusiasm if I might add. After getting seated, we ordered our meals and waited for our fries. Our booth just happend to be right next to the kitchen, which I don't mind at all. But you can hear the bickering between the servers and the line cooks, arguing about who ordered what and who did what blah blah blah. Very unprofessional in my opinion, especially right in front of customers.

Very family friendly. Tablets at tables for ease of ordering drinks and apps.  Tablets also have games for the kids. $1.99 charge while sitting might just be worth it. Food is standard not super high quality, more on par with Denny's, but quantity of fries and variety of burger options is very cool... Not to mention key quality beers on tap (Stella Artois, Sam Adams). Not my first choice, but you could do worse... like McD's.  (OK, If you're in the area and really in the mood for a burger, and willing to leave the mall, less than a mile away, check out Rolling Burger Barn on 2nd and Huntington.)

I decided to give this Red Robbins another try and it was a big improvement from the service compared to what I had the previous time that I came. Our server, Leo, was very friendly and attentive and constantly checking up on us. I had the Peppercorn burger and it was delicious. The only reason I gave this review a 4 star instead of a 5 star was due to the fact that the bottomless fries never came out fresh. Besides that, I have no other complaints and would come again.

Red Robin's food has slowly gone downhill. The burgers are really nothing special, as they are small and dry. The onion rings and sweet potato fries are average. The garlic fries were honestly the only thing that stood out in flavor. The bottomless option is cool, but there's only so much you can have in one sitting. On the plus side, the service was good. The setting and atmosphere is good for socializing with a large group/family. The place doesn't seem to get packed; in other words, it's quite empty and slow. Unfortunately, this just isn't my go-to burger/bar joint.

We went in the afternoon for lunch and the place was really quite. The restaurant was very clean. The food was very tasty and well cooked (we both had burgers). I ordered a root beer float (theyre bottomless if you didn't know) and they brought the root beer and ice cream separate... I don't know why but when I tried to put it together naturally it made a mess... I recommend the restaurant make the drink rather than the customer just to save yourselves some laundry. Other than that the waitress was really nice and we were happy customers

Walked in, gotta seated quickly but it fell apart after we waited for a server or even an acknowledgement for a good 5 minutes. They had time to pull 5-6members for a song but not to say hello we'll be right with you.  Pushed the "call server" button on the little pad but nothing after a couple minutes. Multiple servers passed by but nothing. Lame. Was looking to eat a burger. Management get your crew together and go over basic customer service.

Service sucks here, there's plenty of more restaurants around this mall for you to skip this place. First they messed up our appetizer, me and my BF ordered each a burger, his was requesting no tomato and I was requesting no pineapple ... Sure enough we got or order and they had those ingredients. Smh. It took us forever to get refills and we even experienced a couple walking out next to us because no waiter acknowledged them. Staff/Cooks get it together.

Had dinner tonight here and the overall service was underwhelming to say the least.  Kudos to their check in process where they will text you when your table is ready.  That makes it convenient not to have to hold on to a buzzer.  When we were seated, it took a while for our waiter to show up.  He barely checked on us which was ok, but then our food took a really long time to show up which he did apologize for.   Food:  We got the Red Ramen Burger which is their version of the ramen burger.  It was ok, nothing special.  The ramen was too compact where it was almost too starchy.  We also ordered the Turkey Burger which was pretty good.  The garlic fry upgrade was worth it, it was well seasoned and they weren't shy with the garlic.  And the seasoning that they have at the table is always a huge plus. I'm glad we were able to pay through the table kiosk thing at the tables.  This let us not have to wait to hunt down our elusive waiter.

ASK FOR TREY! If you have been to Red Robin & like it - great. If not, I wouldn't say you should go out of your way to go. The food is just so-so. The burgers could use some basic salt & pepper seasoning while cooking...the beef is kind of bland. I like the steak fries & my friend I was with said the Buzzard sauce was a redeemer for the bland burger. I had the Freckled Lemonade - it's just strawberry lemonade, but quite tasty & a little money gets donated to charity when you order it. BY FAR the highlight of this trip was my server! His name is Trey & he is awesome! He is upbeat & cheerful and not at all lacking in good server skills. We asked him questions about all manner of things on the menu. Trey answered everything with a smile. Then we had a special order & he got everything RIGHT! He was very attentive, but didn't hover. Any time I come back to the Red Robin, I will request to sit in Trek's section! If he's not working, I might eat somewhere else.
Always a solid experience. Of course the Whisky River BBQ Burger is my go to!
Always good food and friendly servers. Bonsai and Whiskey River burgers are their signature items, so are their crispy onion rings.
Welp, Red Robin is Red Robin. The food is sub par, though the last time I went, the service was great. There are machines to pay at your table, so don't bug your waiter when you need to pay.
their staff is very friendly. The hostess escorted us to our seats and our server was extremely nice and patient. Fast service and affordable prices! Best burgers in CA in my opinion

Terrible service and mediocre food. I ordered a bacon cheeseburger and I waited 30 minutes for my order. When my food arrived, they didn't even put bacon in the burger. When I asked for a bacon cheeseburger, the server said, "I'll get you some bacon." I wasn't expecting this, but he literally brought me 3 pieces of bacon on a plate. What's with that? Definitely the worst restaurant in the mall. Won't be back.

If I could give this place half of a star I would. I'm a mall employee and get sick of the typical food court stuff, so Iv dined at this location many of times hoping that it would get better with time but NO! If it's not one thing it's another. They have quite possibly the WORST service iv ever experienced and by the look of most of these reviews I am not the only one who feels this way. I call in a to-go order and the person on the phone says it'll take 10, so I walk up stairs to pick up my order not only is it not ready the hostess/to-go girl charged my card to the wrong order. Once we got that sorted out she goes back to the hostess stand and my friend asks "excuse but is our food ready yet?" (It had already been about 25 min from the time I placed my order over the phone) mind you she's just standing there shooting the breeze then says "oh yeah let me go pack it up". That took another about another 5 minutes. I'm a mall employee I'm in a time crunch here. If you're reading this and considering coming to this location do yourself a favor and take a pass. HORRIBLE just HORRIBLE!!

The venue is nice, close to shopping centers and a little playground for kids. Inside was nice I always like their decor at Red Robins. We got there for happy hour, delicious margaritas, but not that much of a beer variety and don't post there prices up. We got our meals fast and everything tasted great and fresh. Had a great time, will be coming back to this Red Robin.

Hot Mess: I usually like going to red robin to eat but on this particular visit it was a hot mess. Our waitress Sasha seemed a bit overworked and very confused. She took a long time to take our drink order, and our order, she brought the wrong drink, she didn't bring my sauce until I asked for it, she did not ask if we wanted a refill of fries, and for some reason she took away our zoosk never brought a replacement. Sadly we are considering not going back for awhile.

Can I be honest and say I came here just for my free birthday burger? The quality of food and is consistent, one if those rare  places where the pictures of the food on the menu matches what's brought out to you! I would say more on the pricier side but there's points to be earned and coupons available when you sign up with their loyalty program. Service also checks up on you periodically for drink refills, job well done!  Dig their high tech tableside payment system!

LITERALLY THE BEST BURGERS IVE EVER HAD!!! I love and adore this place. I could come here everyday if I could, their hamburgers taste perfect and also their French fries and raspberry iced tea. I always enjoy coming here because it's delicious and their service is great as well. The place is nice and decorated old fashioned which makes your experience so much better! They also have other things to try as well if you don't want a burger. Please  come and eat here, you will not be disappointed!!!! :)))))))))))))))

Our waiter Jesse was amazeballs. He was so attentive and kind, we came to grab a quick bite for diner. We never had to wait for anything we felt like we had some great survice tonight. I will return again especially for there soups
Honestly, the burger is good. However, my wife ordered the wrap..it was horrible.   The salad that came with it were bad too.... Do not irder anything other than burgers...

Terrible service. They take forever to attend to their customers despite having a system that calls the server over, don't get me wrong the food is good and all but service is as stereotypically bad. Also they call it "bottomless fries" however they only give you one chance to give you a refill only ONCE but it's okay because you get half a potato worth of fries instead on one fourth. Terrible and greedy service.

Came here for lunch today after running a few errands. The food here is pretty solid. I had the whiskey burger which was great in flavor. The problem was that the burger came out lukewarm at best. I'm a pretty easy going guy so I let it slide but did mention it to my waitress. Let me say that my waitress Stephanie was pretty awesome and very cute too. She was very engaging and gets props for being a fan of the Walking Dead! :) Well she promptly informed the manager of the issue and he readily took care of me. I think I just got there at a busy time. Otherwise, if you're craving a solid burger, this is the place to go. Oh, and definitely upgrade to the garlic fries as they are really worth the upgrade!

The hostess Nadine moves so slowly we decide to eat somewhere else. From the reviews it seems like the management here really doesn't care that the service sucks we decided to go over to CPK because we can even get seated although there were tons of empty table.  Nadine could care less.

This was my second time eating here. We ordered the tavern mac and cheese, meatballs on a stick and double chicken breast burger on wheat buns. The kitchen made a mistake and thought I ordered the mac and cheese burger but they fixed it. The manager came over to apologize for the wait and I said it's fine. Our server told us that the manager gave us a discount for making us wait so long. I entered my royalty number and there was an additional discount. The total came out to be $19.91 and the original price was $39.95. I tipped $5.00 for excellent customer service. I always get promotions emailed to me but I never have the time to come. I wouldn't mind coming back to eat here if I'm visiting the mall. For bottomless fries and drinks, my tummy was surely satisfied and my son was also full.

Got what you expect from red robin.  decent service, quick response times. only problem was when I asked for bottomless fries in advance while I wait for my food, I ended up just getting it with my food at a much later time

This time the four star is for my server Bernice Anne. She was very friendly and patient with my orders. She has great customer service and understanding. She was very polite as well. Greeted me with a smile is a plus. I was in a rush and she got my to go in under 10mins. Over all I'm satisfied with her service.
Very poor/ slow service. Waited over an hour for our food and the order was wrong. Waitress kept apologizing, but it wasn't her fault. Manager needs to take charge of his/her restaurant.

Since my last review over two years ago, I have been to this specific Red Robin in Arcadia 6 or 7 times, and it has progressively gotten worse and worse.  I've noticed that about all Red Robin's though, not just this one.   Did something change with the company model or structure? We came to this restaurant at about 7:30PM on Friday, September 30.  We sat in the bar area. Although we were assisted promptly, we only saw the server once after the food was delivered.  The burgers seem to be getting smaller and the fry portions seem to be getting smaller too.  Yes, it is unlimited fries and I usually get two portions.  However, if they would just give one slightly larger portion, I wouldn't even want a refill.   Tonight, we were in the bar area, which is higher than the rest of this restaurant.  We had a good view of the kitchen.   In the kitchen during our visit was possibly "the manager" or maybe it was the "kitchen manager".  I don't know.  We were just sitting there counting the ridiculous number of health code violations.  I don't work in that industry; however, they are violations that we read in the newspaper all the time.  First of all, she wasn't dressed to work at Red Robin.  She was dressed as if she was ready to go out on a Friday night.  Kind of unprofessional. Then, she kept swinging her hair back and forth and running her hands through her hair and then seemed to be touching the food.  And she was drinking out of a glass in a open container.  Aren't all of those health violations?   Anyway, on the way out at 8:40PM, I counted 27 empty tables all trashed.  In fact, I didn't notice one bus person in the entire restaurant (not just on the way out; however, the entire time I was in the restaurant).  And guess what?  There was still a wait at 8:40PM and no one could be seated because none of the tables were bussed.  Even in the bar area, our server was bussing tables.  Why would I want to go to a restaurant with a wait, if there were plenty of tables; however, not enough help? I really have noticed the decline in Red Robin over the past 1 to 2 years, and I feel that something changed higher up.  Something not so good.  I have been to probably 7 or 8 locations in the past several years.  A terrible one in Northern California, a pretty bad one in the Vegas area, some bad ones in the LA area; however, the one in Lancaster, PA seemed to be pretty nice.  Anyway, it is a good concept -- I just wish they would fix it.

As it is Sunday, I tried to get hold of Customer Service at Red Robin regarding about $20 off the following visit and they were closed, decided to call Arcadia and Manager Matt horrible customer service stated Oh i am sorry wish I could do something, like there is a way for manager could take care of it. I have been hearing this place doesn't value customer service, has been getting worst and worst with their management. I suggest everyone go somewhere else where they care about customer and is priority, without customer they wouldn't have a job or a restaurant.

This is probably the worst Red Robin we have ever visited.  We have tried it 3 times just to give it a couple second chances and it was consistently disappointing.  From the time you walk in the hostesses(not all, but many) were rude which started the experiences off poorly.  The food was inconsistent, some was ok and some was dried out.  The restaurant always seemed like it needed a good cleaning.  Needless to say we will not be giving anymore chances to this particular RR!

This has to be one of if not THE worst Red Robin ever.  They seem to always get the order wrong, the restaurant is never clean (even though there's hardly anyone there when we go), and overall the managers and staff aren't very personable.  Tried again tonight and will never go back. Orders wrong, manager very unprofessional and overall not an appealing experience.
Kinda bummed out. I got the mac and cheese burger and only got a spoonful of mac and cheese. I'm really too shy to say anything. So I ate it, really bummed.

Our waitress  Sasha was horrible ! My boyfriend  went for the first time and he was very dissatisfied she took forever to bring the food back she got our order wrong and didn't bring us drinks  so very unhappy ! Oh and the drink we got was watered down ! Never coming back ever again !

Complete trash.  Came on a Sunday night. I'd say they were at.. 30% capacity.. service was as slow as a 110% capacity night.  Coke I ordered was flatter than Miley Cyrus' chest.  Boneless wings were dry.  Never got drink refills until she saw us leaving.  Food as a whole- was whatever.  Won't be back to this location ever.  Like ever.

Red Robins is by far my favorite place!! But today my experience at this Santa anita location has changed my mind. First time to this location and forsure my last! First of all I asked for a glass of water and it tasted like crap, so then I asked for a POMOGRANATE ice tea, they brought me REGULAR so had to send that back, then I got the whiskey river chicken burger with NO cheese and of course my burger HAD cheese so had to send that back too, then  when I took a bite out of the burger the bread was burnt and it over powered the burger so had to send that back!!! I didn't get another burger I just didn't want anything anymore, yes the manager came to apologize but yet didn't even bother to give me a discount on my check or anything! Oh and It took 15 mins to get our drinks then another 30 for our food..super slow service! If you want to have a great experience at Red Robins go to the WEST COVINA location they have amazing service they won't disappoint you like this location!!

I use to always eat red robin in high school. Either I did not know much about good food back then, or this location was just not good.  We were seated promptly, and service was friendly. The restaurant was pretty empty for being around dinner time and being located at the mall. They offer a convenient ordering system for drinks, appetizers, and desserts so you don't have to wait for your server to order.  I ordered the shroom burger with regular fries and my fiancé ordered one of the waitress's recommendations with bacon and sweet potato fries. We both got strawberry lemonades. The food came out in a reasonable amount of time where we didn't need appetizers, but the food was just not that great. Both my fiancé's and my burger were soggy and left us feeling gross afterwards. My mushrooms had no flavor and were pretty wet. My fiancé's burger was soggy from the watery lettuce. Both our burgers were dry and my fiancé actually complained on the ride home that he might throw up because he was so bloated and disgusted by his meal.  I love burgers, and I don't have extremely high expectations for them. I really feel like you can't go wrong with burgers, especially mushroom burgers, but it went wrong here. horribly wrong. Our bill came out to be $37 for burgers that just weren't made well. I'd rather eat fast food than dine here again.  Save your appetite. There are such better burger options than here.

Man, I'm usually pretty chill but today I came in to order a chicken salad and they are taking 40min plus and counting as I type this review. Very disappointed, I could of went inside and made my own salad and left before mine would actually come.

I haven't been here in quite a while, but I love bottomless fries!!!!! I wasn't so hungry but just wanted something to munch on and although I wasn't there for long. Lucero was super friendly and courteous. I can see it had been busy but I can see that she was trying her best!
Horrible service, Burgers were extremely DRY! Our server never came back to check on us if we needed anything else. I had 3 kids with me and made my experience very difficult.

Those of you that like dramatic cinema.. you'll love it! This place moves in slow motion!! When you're in the service industry, move quick, and stay alert!  And hey! Here's an idea.. when you say it'll be 20mins, don't mean an hour. Half full.

Need a good place to eat or take to go without the drama?  Red Robin at Westfield Santa Anita is just the ticket!   Despite the fact that mall hogs regularly take the "Pick Up" parking space almost every time I'm picking up an order, it's worth coming for their great wraps and delicious fish and chips.  Everything I've had here is good; from the Jumpstart menu with fried mushrooms and great cheesesticks, to the good portions for clams and fries and clucks and fries and the outstanding Chicken Caesar Wrap.  The service has always been good for me and my friends, and you can even get your Royalty Rewards on items to go as well as dining in.  But whatever you order, save room for their version of a Mud Pie-it's enough for four people and so good.  Since so many American comfort food restaurants/eateries have left Arcadia, it's good to know that even on the busiest of mall days, it's always worth it to come get a good meal in/to go from Red Robin.

I've been to a few of these (West Covina, Glendale and Arcadia) I have to say this place is beyond horrible. From the rude hostess who seem to hate their life, to the awful service the servers provide. A place that has great service will keep you coming back when the food isn't the best, I dread coming here but every once in a while we end up here because they serve alcohol and we're at the mall. I swear this place has the worst of everything, the burgers I've gotten here are gross and dry. That and waiting for 10+ minutes for a refill on drinks is absurd, I've worked with one of the managers (lisa) and I can't believe she let's this type of service go on.  Corporate if you're reading this you need to do something ASAP because this is the only location that needs this much work

If I could leave 0 stars, I would. I experienced my first Racial Descrimination here. I am a millennial in college & didn't think this was alive in Southern California.  My server was Paula (who is white). When taking our order she was rude to my friends who weren't Caucasian. She forgot it, and someone else had to come back.  Put food came back cold and sloppy. Before leaving we told her it was my bday, she said that did nothing for me. My friend said 'lReally because someone else got a Sunday!" So she came by and literally tossed a Sunday at us and unlike the other customer, no one sang Happy Bday. Now, I'm not a rewards member. Reward members get a whole cake!  She never once came by after that. We asked someone else for the bill.  After charging our cards to pay the bill she came back to me and asked me if it was my real debit card of if I had pick pocketed someone. I had an Angry Orchard! She checked my ID PREVIOUSLY!  I am so upset and even thought about calling my lawyer! I am Mexican- American and have dark complexion.... but I am educated and cute (if I do say so myself). Ultimately I decided to post this to let everyone know that this location is far from professional. Avoid going here, Paula could have spit at my food, it was extremely obvious to my friends and I that she is racist, as she treated our light skin friendse with good customer service and was just nasty to me.

Ok so we were shopping for a few things and when we were done we headed up to Red Robin to have a few drinks. Our bartender Paula was spectacular!  My husband ordered a double Jack n coke and I ordered a double Bacardi n diet coke. She made them perfectly which is what I expect from a double drink. Went down nice n easy and left us with a great shopping experience.  Thanks Paula!
Great service and they always make sure I get back to work within my lunch time, since I work at the mall!

I really really love the food here. The big problem for me and for a lot of people is the level of inconsistency that appears to happen in both kitchen and serving areas. I am a loyal customer and a rewards user but 7 times out of 10 I have to let the server know of a mistake of some sort. The only person that really does have it together is the server Stephanie but we rarely get to see her. Consistency is the problem and once they get it right their stars will go up till then two stars will do.

Not sure what happened to this Red Robbin but service had gone way down hill.  This used to be our favorite go to place for burgers but the last few times the servers have been fairly inattentive and lackluster in the friendly department.  Each time we come we see how long it'll take for the server to ask if we want drink refills (since it's been slowly becoming less frequent).  Tonight: zero times.  Sigh.  At least the food is always good.

Red Robbins is a great pick for large groups with quality burgers. If you're just with a date, skip the line and go sit at the bar. Gets busy so call in to make a reservation. Located in the promenade side of the mall, near Macy's.   Blue Ribbon Burger: 5/5 I've ordered this burger my first time here because I love the taste of bleu cheese, and I fell in love with this burger. So i've really only tried this burger. It's got fried onion strings, a delicious warm patty, bleu cheese, aioli sauce, etc. Definitely give this one a try.  Strawberry Lemonade: 5/5 Unlimited strawberry lemonade with actually strawberry pieces in it! Refreshing and amazing.  Root beer Float: 5/5 Bottomless root beer float with a large scoop of French Vanilla Ice cream. WORTH its price.  Garlic Parmesan Season Fries: 5/5 Always upgrade your fries to these. They are amazing and are bottomless too.

Customer service can make or break a place: Complaint 1) the hostess did not even greet us. She just walked away and came back to seat us a few moments later.  Complaint 2) they took almost 40min to bring our food out and when they did they brought out the other table's food, not ours. Not once did the server come to check on us. They never even brought out my drink. I had to request for it after they brought our food (40min later).  Complaint 3) My order wasn't right. I requested a turkey sandwich and got a turkey burger. I also requested for cheese and did I get that? Nope. I wasn't going to bother changing my order again.  The two stars is for for food only, but they definitely lack customer service!!!

I've read the reviews about this place but decided to give it a try. My server was Denise, she had a great personality and treated us with care. I will keep coming back as long as there are more employees like Denise. Thank you.

Want to try some where new other then Islands .. I ordered the Enchiladas Salad and it was horrible!! The salad obviously came from a bag and it was not fresh .. the servers was great !! But sorry to say will be our first and last time ..

The food was adequate, it was just the wrong order. Combine that with very slow service and being talked down to. . . Now you've hit the trifecta! Plenty of places to eat in the mall, or anywhere, for that matter. This store has dropped off in quality in the last 12 months. I'm usually pretty loyal, but I see no reason to be now

They don't honor their rewards. Blame the program for issues. Slow service. No customer service. I advised the waiter of a reward I had for a free birthday burger. Ended up only getting 1/2 off.  This is mot my first unpleasant experience at this location.. i will not be back.

Very attentive and friendly servers. Burger (Black and Bleu) was pretty tasty, not the best blue cheese burger I've ever had, but still pretty good. Delicious free fry dipping sauces.  Good for groups. I would check it out if you're somehow at this mall and don't feel like eating something Asian.

Food: YES.  Service: NO.  Been coming to this particular RR for YEARRRS! I used to work at a restaurant within the mall and would come by often with coworkers for food and for drinks. Though I no longer work at the mall, I still meet up with friends here because we really enjoy the food.  I've always sat at the bar since the day it opened but these last few times have basically been crap and don't see the point in sitting there anymore because I feel like I'm being neglected and treated differently. I don't want to pull the racist card here but I don't have any other explanation as to why I am treated so poorly by this server.  We came in and considered getting a table but there was nobody at the front and there were a couple of parties in front of us waiting for a host or someone to come by to seat them. I suggested that we go to the bar so we wouldn't have to wait too long since we had an idea of what we were going to order.  There was one other couple sitting up at the bar that were finishing up and leaving soon. Paula came by to ask us what we wanted to drink and we asked for water first and she responded, "I still need to see your ID if you want to sit up here". We showed her our IDs as she returned with our waters. My friend ordered a Stella and I hadn't made up my mind yet and she left. It took her a while to come back directly to us but she came back to make bar drinks. I can understand that the bar is somewhat of an inconvenience because it's elevated from the rest of the restaurant and it can be hard to see but she didn't make an effort to see if we're gonna order food or just drinks. A group of three girls came and sat next to us at the bar and she was quick to greet them right away and as she was asking for their beverages, she asked if they wanted to see menus for food. She gave it to them and continued to neglect us; we had to flag her down for the menus. More parties were starting to show up at the bar and she was attending to them. Someone who I assumed was the manager came by to talk to the three girl and asked if they were ready to order. He took their orders and did not say anything to us. I know Paula was busy walking back and forth between the kitchen, new tables and the bar but she never looked our way. We did not end up ordering until 30 minutes after we sat and we ordered last. How do I know? Everybody that came after us had gotten their food before us. I ended up ordering a Stella and she didn't bring it until about 20 minutes later. She forgot and when she realized it she dropped it off without a word. An apology would've been nice, I don't know why she delayed my drink. I saw her put it in the computer and she's the one pouring all the drinks! Paula's attitude changed once our food arrived. Another server brought it out and the only thing we asked from Paula was extra napkins. The bar was clearing out as it was getting close to their closing time and she explained how to close out our checks on the little device and said goodbye to us when we left.  ------ The last time I came with another girlfriend, Paula was also at the bar and it was pretty much the same thing. Said we need to show our IDs if we wanted to sit up at the bar. She looked busy and I know she was busy because she kept complaining about it to her coworkers. Didn't get menus til we asked for it, took forever to order. Ignored, neglected, and not cared for.  I gave her the benefit of the doubt and thought she was just having a bad day but I've been lucky enough to have her as my server at the bar for so many times that I actually believe she hates me. It upsets me because before I even get to say a word to her she decides to be rude to me or treat me like a child. I'm nearly 30 and can read; I know that 21+ can only sit at the bar, I'm not needy and I rarely make modifications when I order. What did I do to her to make her hate me? I've been a server for nearly 10 years and know the good and the many ugly sides of the restaurant industry and know what it's like to be treated below others. If I was a regular guest and treated her like crap, I could understand her reciprocating the mutual feelings. Ugh, but every damn time I come? I always come with different friends and she treats my friends and I like crap each time!!!  I wish I was able to tell the manager on duty but I never see them when I'm there! And this last time I did see a manager, he ignored us for prettier girls! Thanks RR.  This is the last time I'll be dining at the RR in Santa Anita. Goodbye.

If I could give zero stars I could. I have always enjoyed going to Red Robin, however, this location needs some serious help. I went there with my mom on Saturday evening to what we thought would be a fun evening out celebrating a birthday.  It was anything but that.   The service was absolutely horrible and the restaurant was not that busy.  My mom wanted sweet tea and the server said they don't serve it.  We said it was on the menu and he said they have never had it.  At that point we placed our order and waited over 30 minutes to get our food.  Once it did come out it was cold.  The burger and fish were cold as well as the fries and onion rings.  Once our server decided to come to our table again we told him that it wasn't even luke warm and he said that the order had been sitting for a while.  We asked if they could please heat it up and he came back with just the fries and onion rings (not the burger or fish).  Never saw him again till it was time to pay.  Never got refills on our iced teas (that weren't sweet teas obviously) and the bottomless fries here must be a joke because nobody ever stopped by to see if we wanted more.   Every Red Robin I have ever been to has done something special for a birthday at the end of the meal but not at this location (according to our waiter).  Won't be going back.

I wish negative stars were available because this place truly deserves it. We went during a weekday when it opened, so there were maybe 3 other tables besides ours. The bench seats had crumbs and greasy stains and the table was sticky. We were ignored by the staff and the guy I presumed to be the manager by the way he was dressed. The wait staff/management were too busy engrossed in their own LOL conversations to notice us. When the waitress finally came to our table, she let out a loud burp and laughed it off saying that she had just drunk a soda too fast. Not an "excuse me" or any other apology, and when she saw we didn't think it was very funny, her attitude got even worse. It took forever to get our food and when we did it was pathetic. The food was cold and there were only 5 french fries in the cup on our plate. Really??  I know it's supposed to be bottomless fries, but when you never see the waitress after you get your food, what's the point? This is the worst restaurant that we have been to in a while.

I've only come to this location three times and this last time was terrible! It took more time than usual to get our order in. Then we waited almost an hour for the food to come out. Tables around us were also complaining about the wait time and lack of service. It seemed like the waitress in our section was overwhelmed by the amount of people that needed to be served. She was a sweet girl, but not fit for a busy Friday night. The food was just okay. Honestly, I could go to Denny's and have the same flavor experience. My garlic aoli tasted more like tarter sauce and was light on the garlic. Endless fries is kind of joke because they give you a basket with a small handful that, between five adults, only lasts about five minutes. Red Robin's new slogan should be Red Robin, mmmmmmmmmm...... because it wasn't that great and definitely not yummmmmm.

Went there today for lunch, the hostess looked unhappy to be there, no smiles on her face. The server gave my friend and I French fries and sweet potato fries cold, this is the second visit that this has happened. After you get your food, your server doesn't come around much, since you don't have to pay your waiter. I love Red Robin, just not this location....

This place is amazing! Not for the burgers, (though they are very delicious) but for the waitress that work there. Denise and Paula especially.  They're best people to go for if you want to have someone who caters to your food the exact way you like it, but also a waiter who cares about how you are. I can go on and on about their wonderful service but it doesn't do it true justice. Just go and see what the hype is about!

I enjoyed eating my free birthday burger (Grilled Turkey) with sweet potato fries tonight. My server gave me a birthday sundae, but there was no lit candle and birthday song. I'm sad and disappointed because I was hoping that the servers will sing "Happy Birthday" to me  (my bday was two weeks ago - May 2). They sang to the other guests who were celebrating their birthdays too.

We loved our burgers though they were on the expensive side. Had a similar experience as many of the other reviewers here: the food was good but it took awhile to get seated and the servers seem harried and distracted.
What happened to this place? It used to be my go-to restaurant, and now the service and food is horrible! Also I dare you to try to have them give you refills on the endless fries!

My wife and I went to this Red Robin after the Irwindale renaissance faire in Irwindale. The place had some people but it was not super busy. We asked for a table that was half booth and half chairs. When the front host took us to our table it was all chairs. We saw 4 areas that were half booth and tables that had a server assigned to but it was like pulling teeth to get what we asked for. After waiting 20min with other parties being settled and the same party size we got what we asked for. Again the place was not that busy. Our waiter was cool at first. Really talkative easy to get along with. We ordered our drinks and asked for a few minutes to look at the menu. Ten minutes later we got our drinks and we were ready to order by then but having our drinks earlier would have been cool. Again not that busy. We ordered our food it came out and all but I already went through my drink. With empty glass on table I asked for a refill of my drink which had been empty for ten minutes by now. Sure thing..... 10 minutes later we were asked how everything was. We said the food was great but where is my refill to wash it all down. Oh yeah forgot about that. So I asked while he was getting mine to refill my wife bottomless root beer float. He came back with my drink then left. Time went by he came back to clear the table and my wife ask where her refill was and he replied he forgot to put the order in. My wife asked if she could get one to go and the waiters reply was 'then it wouldn't be bottomless now would it?' And left. Again it was not busy and we were a group of four.  I don't think I will return to this Red Robin. This was the second RR that we went to in a month (the other in Escondido) that we received crumby service. I think it maybe time to get some new franchise liaisons to train in customer service. Thanks.

Food was good. Had the simple chicken sandwich. It includes bottomless fries but this only means they bring out a quarter of what other restaurants do and you have to keep asking for more. Drinks were good. Their sangria is strong. The waitress didn't come around as often as we would have liked but she was nice. My boyfriend had a burger.

I think this place is holding on for dear life. Food was mediocre and the service was mediocre at best  but are you kidding me with that side bowl of soup that came with my sandwich? It was literally like 3 spoonfuls worth. The ice tea with flavored syrup was kinda gross. The bottomless fries is kind of a joke considering they give you a small cup of like 6 fries and then they come back with some really cold fries in a basket. Why is this place still in business? The higher powers at be, please fix these food quality problems or just let it go.

Always solid. The burgers are always juicy and fresh. For some reason we always get the same server. I'm glad because he's awesome. I don't remember his name but he's a ginger with a beard. He's a super nice guy and he always checks on us. It's a great place to grab lunch.

I love these burgers. .well actually I only get one. The same one for years now. I get the bacon avocado in size petite  (so I can have a bunch of fries!!!) This particular location is always freezing. But they have really great servers and my food is consistently delicious  They send me coupons all the time and they have plenty of mall parking. There's even a sweet little playground right outside for the little ones.

There's a red robin 5 minutes away from my house so when I'm out and about and see this, I usually don't eat there BUT we were shopping here, checking out the stores that they have outside & all of a sudden, my brother wanted Red Robin fries. So, here we are - visiting Red Robin (even though we have one 5 minutes away from home that we ALWAYS go to - even though there's so many new restaurants to try here). We walked in and it was pretty empty - it was around 11:30-almost noon. A few minutes go by and a girl comes by and takes us to our seats - we weren't sure who our server was and it was probably 5 or so minutes til this guy came, introduced himself and asked us for our drink orders. We both got water - and he said he'd come back in a bit. A few more minutes go by and he comes to drop off our waters and leaves before we even had a chance to tell him we were ready to order. Im going to go ahead and say it took about 15 minutes from the moment we sat down til when we finally ordered our food. On a busy day, I understand - there's a lot of people BUT on a week day when its not even crowded - was a little weird. We ordered and within a few minutes our appetizer came out. We got the boneless bbq wings and it was delicious. It wasn't hot though or warm - more like it was done a while already and then he brought it out. A few minutes later, our burgers came out and I KID YOU NOT I ONLY HAD 6 PIECES OF FRIES ON MY PLATE. My brother and I looked at each other and bursted out laughing. By this point, I was over it - I ate my food, asked for a refill of fries - which took so long to come out that I didn't even want it anymore. Of course I ate it though because I didn't want to waste it but man.. I don't know what was up with this place or the worker. Everyone working didn't look happy to be there. We felt like we were bothering them by being there. Definitely sticking to the location by our house.

Very bad service at this location, wasnt that packed arou d 6:30pm on a Sunday evening. No napkins, no utensils, no drinks. Took them a good 30 minutes to bring anything out. Ordered the Cluck and fries, portions were really small compared to the west covina location. Had a promo for a free burger but the store manager wouldnt honor that either. Would not recommend coming here, your better off eating at those other places at the mall.

The dinning experiment is fine, but don't do takeout. It seems like no one from the TOGO department are able to get anything right. Every time I order takeout, something is missing or wrong. For example, I ordered a salad that was supposed to come with a side of toast, but I didn't receive it. Another instance, I ordered a Tavern Siracha burger but I received a normal double cheeseburger. Very disappointing and frustrating. I suggest the staff should be train again.
Burgers are delicious, staff was friendly... has the bonzai burger very succulent overall great tasting burger and can't go wrong with bottomless fries .

One would hope to see a hostess on a Saturday evening when walking in to this establishment. I was with my two year old and we were standing around as waiters and waitresses passing by did not notice me standing there to be seated. The restaurant was empty. The hostess finally arrived and seated us. For how slow they were the service I received was super disappointing, might as well have eaten in the food court. He forgot my straw and took forever to come back to check on me. The hostess kept walking back and forth -she would not even look my way, but seemed to acknowledge the couple in front of us each time. Someone else brought the food out. I realized he forgot the dressing to my salad. The server normally checks up shortly after to see if everything was ok. My server was no where to be found. By the time he came around for me to ask for the dressing, my son was done with his meal. Hostess surprisingly was up front when I left- she did not say thank you nor a bye, someone needs to let her know she should not have her back facing to the door since it is rude and unwelcoming, especially if she is not acknowledging guests leaving. Terrible experience, never felt so Unwelcomed, it was sad to see the couple across being attended too and me and my son being disregarded.

I was shopping w/ hubby on a Tuesday night in July. We decided to have dinner before clothes shopping. We waited briefly to get a table and sat in a booth. The waiter didn't seem too excited to work on that day because he had a monotone voice. We ordered our drinks and didn't wait too long for it's arrival. I usually get a guacamole bacon burger but decided on burning love burger. We didn't wait too long for my burger to arrive. It looks like they gave me small amount of fries. At least it's free refill on fries. I didn't like cornmeal bun because it's cornnmeal. Otherwise the burger was juicy and medium with some pink. The waiter was good on refills on drinks and fries. After we ate, we paid on the machine of each table. It's very convenient so we don't have wait for the waiter.

I love how they have bottomless fries and drinks.  The food here can be decent but pretty average but the service here is truly amazing.   Our server was super attentive and continuously checked up on us.  She made sure that we were fully stocked on our drinks and fries and she would refill them almost instantly.  She had a great attitude and was very friendly throughout the whole night.  There really needs to be more servers like her.   I tried out the Teriyaki Chicken Burger ($10.79), which is basically like one of those hawaiian burgers with teriyaki sauce and pineapple, but with chicken instead of a burger patty.  It was pretty good, except for the fact that I got a small part of burnt chicken (photo shown) just sticking out of the burger.  It was small enough that I could just cut off the piece and eat the rest of the burger though.   Like I said, the food here is average, nothing too outstanding, but the service here was quite amazing.  If you sign up for their club then you get a free burger on your birthday month!

The only reason I ever come back to this restaurant is the food quality is generally good.  However, the service is usually very slow.  They ask if you want a burger medium and it comes out well done.  If you want to actually get bottomless fries, good luck.  They say they carry seasonal beers in the menu, then say not really.  It is not a well-managed restaurant.

Thursday August 3rd, at approximately 4:10pm, my family and I walked into Red Robin  located at the Santa Anita mall in Arcadia, California. We were greeted and escorted to a seating area that comprised of a round table with dining chairs which had  standard to normal padding. We respectfully requested to be seated at a booth which had more padding and back support due to my mother's back for which she has a handicap disability. The waitress told us to wait by the round table as she had to clear it by her manager who was standing 10 feet away from us. As we waited, we observed most of the booths were readily available and that they could hold four adults and a child. The waitress came back and told us that she's sorry and that they could ONLY sit us at the round table at the time. I asked her why we couldn't sit sit the booth and she didn't have an answer other than "sorry we can only sit you here right now. I will say about 80 percent of the restaurant was empty. I am really disappointed in the restaurant and the customer service as I have worked in the business and do EVERYTHING I can to keep customers happy and returning. I am more upset at the fact that my mother was turned down, or wasn't able to be accommodated due to her back problems. It makes me wonder how many people have had this happened to them in the past and why it seems to CONTINUE.   #notadacompliant  #americanswithdisablities #betterbusinessbureau #poorserviceredrobin#shameonyou   #disabledanddiscriminated
Really bad tasting burgers. French fries were cold. No service at all - waited for service longer than time spent eating. Don't waste time and money & instead go to a local fast food burger spot.

I come here a lot with my wife and kids.  They have terrific burgers and bottomless sides.  I.E. I usually get the broccoli and they are bottomless along with the fries.  My kids love the food which includes grilled chicken and excellent mac and cheese.  Service has always been great as well.

Yesterday's visit wasn't as great as it normally is! Service was okay, but it was the food that just didn't seem to have the same quality. I ordered the "clucks & shrimp" the chicken tenders were good and so were the fries...but the fried shrimp weren't good. The breading was soggy on the inside and falling off of the shrimp itself . I wasn't a big fan of the coleslaw they had on the plate either .  I let the server know about the issue with the shrimp so she was helpful to get some more that were freshly fried and the manager brought them out so that was cool on their part .  My boyfriend ordered his hamburger medium and they gave it to him well done...it was still good but just seemed like they weren't on top of the little things yesterday .

This place sucks . Service is horrible and good luck getting refills on your drinks and fries. Do not recommend, i was there a few days ago and it was my first time ,worst place to eat never going back .Sadly to say there's better service at McDonald's.

Sadly I feel like Red Robin has gone down in quality and service. Everything is mostly automated now and it is not as crowded as it was before. I came here for dinner after the mall for a quick dinner bite. For some reason I ordered the Cod and Shrimp Plate which came with 2 pieces of fried fish chips and a couple pieces of shrimp. It was definitely not worth the price which was around $15. I did not feel too good afterwards and I felt like the shrimp might have been weird. There is a little machine at your table where you can order appetizers and pay with your credit card.  PRO: Endless steak fries which are still pretty tasty to me!
Couldn't help but leave a review because of the great service, thank you so much Paula (I hope that's that lady bar tenders name) on point!! Fun night and dinner definitely coming back again
I went to this location about noonish to place a take out order. The hostess was awesome. I ordered the Grilled Chicken sandwich. The chicken was moist and delicious. Hats off to the cook.
Great place too eat. Brian the waiter is the best waiter here and management as well. i love coming here for lunch.

Amazingly slow service.  The restaurant can be half empty but they will still tell you the wait is about 15 or 20 minutes. (What? Why can't you sit me at that table over there?) The servers are nice and polite but don't come around enough to refill the bottomless sides or drinks to the level of my liking.  And it always seems that something with the order is not quite right (wrong side given, missing garlic toast, etc.) - minor but annoying.  They just seem to be perpetually understaffed.  If you're not in a hurry, an okay place for burgers and fries.

It's the perfect vintage place to grab a quick bite for a reasonable price! I love their bottomless fries meaning that we can have unlimited fries and the seasoning is on point! I got the Wild West burger and it's fantastic!

I'm a little disappointed at this Red Robin in Arcadia. Besides the fact that the waiter was nice he was not at all that great in service.   We waited too long in receiving drinks, meals, bottomless fries which never actually came out when promised.  My burger meat wasn't well done as I requested.  My sweet potato fries looked like someone already ate from them. Not at all the service I would expect from them.  Definitely wouldn't recommend this particular restaurant nor will I come back.
There are a lot of new burgers places out there, but for shear selection you can't beat Red Robin  service is generally ok and the food is always very good

It wasn't all that great. Service was just okay and it wasn't even busy. They managed to ruin my craving for sweet potato fries....I really wanted some so I asked for it as my side despite the extra charge. When I asked for a second helping, they told me it would be twenty to thirty minutes because they were completely out. If they knew that was the case, why would they let me take the extra charge? Mind you, the sweet potato fries I initially got felt like they've been sitting around for a good while.  Anywho, this won't stop me from having Red Robin again but I might reconsider coming to this location...

I was so thrilled to see the RRGB introduce the healthy and vegetarian options on their menu. Though don't get them wrong, The Protein Style Wedgy Burger from the "healthy" green looking page is filled with beef and bacon. However, the service is way too slow but friendly. I waited 10 minutes for the kids menu and 15 minutes for my beer. You can get way faster and better quality service for a $15 burger.

I've never been treated as such I arrived and the couple that arrived after I did got seated! Sooooo extremely rude!! I had hungry kids with me sun assholes never ever returning there again. I jut walked out took my business somewhere else!

Weak drinks. I mean WEAK drinks. When we asked for them to remake them we got attitude from the bartender stating that we ordered sweet drinks so there was obviously "not going to be a lot of alcohol" . Way too much attitude in my opinion. We're paying for an alcoholic beverage we expect atleast a little bit of alcohol!

Serviced improved a bit for this visit although they burnt my burger.  We had the same server as before, I believe she's the manager at the bar (short hair and glasses).  She was servicing the whole bar as well as what seems like half the restaurant. So she was jammin as much as she could while taking the time to talk to her tables and connect in a personal level. I dig that. Even though they burnt my burger the first time, she definitely took it back and make it right. I hate complaining and sending things back, but that thing tasted like a brick of char.  Waitress was apologetic and made me feel at ease by sending the burger back and took full responsibility. Will be back, as I always do especially having the rewards thing.

I mean, it's pretty good. It's Red Robin so you get what you're expecting to get. However, there's not one time I've walked out of here feeling like my stomach wasn't going to burst with garlic fries. The lemonade is pretty good, I recommend.

I really enjoyed my meal tonite. Had the southwestern chicken salad. Chicken was cooked perfectly with delicious southwest seasoning. The salad was huge and very fresh. I also had strawberry lemonade. Very good. Real lemons with strawberry's. Prices reasonable and great service.

The service here was awesome when I came yesterday for lunch with a friend. The location is great too; it was great to come here after doing some shopping in the mall. I ordered a Burnin' Love burger, cooked a little medium rare, and it was cooked perfectly! If you like a little spice, this burger is delicious. I love the fried jalapeno coins inside the burger. It came with bottomless steak fries, and the refills for the fries came promptly at our table so I was pleased. I also ordered a bottomless freckled (strawberry) lemonade, and the refills for that also came right when I finished the last glass. Use the bottle of seasoning on your table on the fries! It's perfect with some ranch on the side too!

Our server was nice but the management of the restaurant needs improvement.  Took my family here for dinner and to watch the dodger game. The host sat us away from their very tiny TV so we asked if we could sit at a nearby empty booth. His first response was they don't have enough servers in that section. We insisted we would like to be closer to the TV and he said something like that booth is not ready.  We didn't want to argue so we just sat where he originally appointed. When I took my daughter to the restroom I realized why he didn't sit us at that emptied booth...the table had not been cleaned.  There were multiple emptied tables that were filled with dirty dishes and napkins. It was a mess. I don't know how long they were left dirty but nobody cleaned it the entire time we were at the restaurant. It was not a good experience. The food was decent but we could not enjoy it because we couldn't even see the score of the game! (They have this fancy table gadget where you can order food, play games and pay your bill but it's so unnecessary. It was a bit confusing and didn't even work properly. They should have invested in bigger TVs). If it was for the nice server the restaurant would get zero stars.

If you're feeling for a burger, Red Robin is one of the places you'll need to be. Good thing about this place is that they have TVs everywhere and the service is great! Staff here are so friendly from the host to the servers. The burgers weren't that bad also. Been here twice and both times have been great. There was a tv that was off and because we got seated in the back area, we kindly asked them if they could turn on the Lakers game. The hostess was patient as I was looking for the channel since I don't have DirectTV. She ended up changing it for us.  As for the burger, I told them how I wanted my burger and it was made perfectly. Bottomless fries doesn't hurt as well. Great thing about this place because of the bottomless fries which goes well with their seasoning and ketchup. The only thing that wasn't great was the chicken breast that we had ordered for our daughter. It was kind of salty. I can't say all of the chicken breasts were salty but most of them were and she didn't enjoy it. Overall though, great service and good food.
A bit pricey for the quality. I have forgotten what burger I got - it was unremarkable for the price. The unlimited fries are good. The trivia thing is fun.

I just had the worst experience I've ever had at a red robin in my life! I ordered $15 burgers and they were dry and tasteless. The server didn't clear our table during the duration of the meal and began stacking plates on top of dirty plates on the table instead of removing them and acted really put out when asked for simple things like dressing or to-go boxes. The whole $50 meal experience was just SO disappointing :( this use to be one of my favorite spots, but it's just become overpriced and lackluster. Great menu, but bad execution. I will definitely not be returning

This was maybe my second visit ever to a Red Robin.  There was a 10-15 min wait for a group of 8.  The service was kind but a little spotty, we always had to ask for more water and when we asked for more fries (since they were bottomless), it did take awhile.   I got the Royal Red Robin, which had bacon, egg, cheese, lettuce and tomatoes.  They do give you the option to cut down on the calories by going bunless or having just one half of the bun as well as skipping fries and opting for a side salad or veggie.  The burger was good, not the best but it wasn't bad.   The burger my husband had gotten was a lot more flavorful--the Smoke & Pepper.  I was skeptical since it came with a ciabatta bun, but the bun was thin and complemented the burger.  The fries are the thick type and they don't come in a big portion probably because they come bottomless.  Not sure if I would come back in the future, mostly because the food was mediocre.

Surprisingly, this location has fantastic service all around.. food came our perfect, friendly staff.. they actually check up on us several times! I can't say that about their other locations I've been to. Great job and keep it up!

This Red Robin location has improved greatly comparing to the last several years with less waiting time, excellent response by waiters and above all, food is good and they serve cherry coke without any mistake unlike the other locations that serve me coke 99% of the time when I request cherry coke.
